Con el préstamo que recibirá de la institución  va a comprar abono para sus tierras y potreros para cultivar otros productos para la venta y el consumo familiar.

 su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) Communal Bank is made up of a group of feisty women who are determined to be successful in their work and their daily lives in order to obtain a better future for their families. They all live in the beautiful city of Cuenca, known for its culture, architecture, traditions, people and rich gastronomic delights. María V. has been a member of the Nuevos Horizontes Communal Bank for three years. Little by little she has grown her agricultural business cultivating vegetables, farming from 8am until 12pm. She also raises chickens, guinea pigs and she has one cow whose milk is for household consumption, although, occasionally she sells it to her friends in the community. She sells what little she grows in the Cuenca’s marketplace. Our member lives in the parish of Sayausi in the Ramales neighborhood. She is 46 years old and has been divorced for the past 20 years due to the infidelity of her husband. With him she has 5 children between the ages 20 and 27 years old. Her oldest and youngest children work and help her with the household costs. The other three children are married and live independently. From her other relationship, she has two children who are currently 11 and 8 years old. She lives with her four children in her own house. With the loan that she will receive from the institution, she will buy fertilizer for her fields and pastures in order to grow more produce to sell and for her family to eat. Her dream is to stay healthy in order to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields and pastures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing livestock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine W. Gichehais a 42 year old widow with four children. Three of her children attend school. Catherine has owned a beauty shop where she sells cosmetics and hair products among other products for the last seventeen years. She employs one person.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, Catherine previously received a loan of Kes.50,000.  Her business has grown from a retail to wholesale business since she became a member of Faulu Kenya.  Now Catherine is requesting a loan of Kes. 75,000  to expand her business by increasing her stock of cosmetics.  Catherine, who describes herself as hardworking and trustworthy, hopes to  become a distributor of cosmetics in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 46 years old and married to Martha Wanjiru, a businesswoman. He has built some rental houses in Kangemi where they also live. This is his primary business and he has been running it for the last two years now. Kangemi is a busy and highly populated area so these houses are in demand. Besides this, he offers wielding services for some extra income for the family. 

Michael got to know about KADET through some friends who were already members. This is his first loan with KADET although he has borrowed from other financiers before. He wants to buy materials to construct a two-bedroom iron-sheet building to add to what he already has.

Michael plans to buy another plot and build some more houses to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a two-bedroom iron-sheet building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Yadira Antonia

texts.es:
Yadira  F. es una barranquillera que sabe mucho de negocios, que expresa su experiencia de hace 20 años y  las diferentes actividades que realiza y que hasta ahora se han sostenido dan cuenta de ello. En su casa todos trabajan: su esposo es taxista y tienen 2 hijos de 20 y 23 años de edad, que también trabajan; ellos son precisamente la razón por la cual empezó su negocio, para agregar un ingreso más al hogar e invertirlo en sus estudios, porque su esposo tenía una gran responsabilidad en los gastos del hogar y ella consideró un deber el apoyarlo en este propósito.
Inició vendiendo pasteles a sus vecinos y fue expandiéndose y añadiéndole otro producto como el queso, que vende en porciones de libra o de kilo a solicitud del cliente. Observadora de su clientela, Yadira ha logrado comprender otras necesidades y por eso incursionó también en la venta de mercancía variada, como electrodomésticos, ropa y calzado, tres negocios en los que interactúa y cada vez muestran su potencial de crecimiento; con esta percepción se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar su primer crédito, quiere comprar queso en mayor cantidad pues conoce que deja buena rentabilidad y también invertir en pequeños electrodomésticos, cosmético y ropa femenina para responder a pedidos de clientes, que necesitan hacer sus regalos, con motivo de la celebración del día de las madres en el mes de Mayo, asì  jóvenes adultos, hombres y mujeres envuelven los obsequios de su madre, suegra, cuñada, y hasta la vecina o amiga, en fin toda la que sea madre biológica o haya cumplido con el roll de madre.
Yadira a sus 50 años es una mujer trabajadora que sueña principalmente con el crecimiento de su negocio, pues se ve en el futuro con una mejor infraestructura de negocio y ayudando con tenacidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira Montalvo is a woman from Barranquilla who knows a lot about business. She has 20 years of experience, and the different activities she has done to support herself are proof of that. In her house everyone works. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have two children, 20 and 23 years old. They also work. They are the exact reason that she started her business. She started in order to add another income to the household and to invest in their education. Her husband had a great responsibility with the household expenses, and she considered it her duty to help him with this objective. She started selling cakes to her neighbors. She was expanding and adding other products like cheese, which she sells by the pound or kilo at the customer’s request. She observes her customers, and Yadira has come to understand other needs. She also started selling various merchandise like domestic appliances, clothes, and footwear. She interacts in the three businesses, and each time they show their potential for growth. With this perception, she came to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her first loan. She wants to buy cheese in greater quantities as she knows that it is very profitable. She also wants to buy small domestic appliances, cosmetics, and clothes for women to respond to her customers’ orders. They need to give gifts for the celebration of Mother’s Day in May. Young adults, men, and women wrap the gifts for their mothers, mothers-in-law, sisters-in-law, and even their neighbors or friends. They buy gifts for their biological mothers or anyone who has filled the roll of mother. Yadira, age 50, is a hard-working woman who primarily dreams of the growth of her business. In the future she sees her business with a better infrastructure, and she sees herself tenaciously helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese in larger quantities, domestic appliances, cosmetics, and clothes for women

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: Cinthia, de 29 años, es una mujer ambiciosa, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos pequeños en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la compra y venta de productos comestibles, mientras que su esposo lo realiza en otro lugar. Para ella es muy importante al momento de adquirir su mercadería, siempre toma en cuenta la fecha de vencimiento de cada producto, de esa manera se gana la confianza de sus clientes. Este negocio le es muy rentable, debido a que se encuentra en lugar estratégico, donde hay mucha circulación de gente. Por ello, trabaja desde las 8 de las mañana hasta las 1 de la tarde. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar su capital de trabajo, para que pueda abastecer su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece a sus compañeras de su grupo que admitieron su ingreso, ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Cinthia tiene planeado invertir el crédito, en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, de esa manera podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Cinthia, who is 29, is an ambitious woman. She lives alongside her husband and their two small children in a rented house. For more than three years, she has been dedicated to the buying and selling of consumable products while her husband does the same thing in another place. For her, it is very important at the moment of acquiring her merchandise always to account the expiration date of each product and, in this way, gain the trust of her customers. This business is very profitable since it is located in a strategic place where many people circulate. For this, she works from 8 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. He greatest goal is to expand her working capital so she can supply her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is thankful to her colleagues from her group who allowed her to join since it will be very useful for the progress of her business. Cinthia plans to invest the loan in the purchase of basic necessity products so she will be able to expand her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more basic necessity products.

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhen, S. ( in photo) 27, and her husband, Mr. Phanna So, 33, have been married since 2001. They have two sons. One of them attends school and another one is still too young for school. Besides her sons, she also has her elderly mother living with her.  

Sokhen has been a garment factory worker for six years, while her husband has been an electrician for ten years. The couple is in the process of building their new house but they lack funds to finish part of it.  So, Sokhen is requesting her first loan of US$ 700 to in order to complete their house.

loans.use: To finish  building her house.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Lidia V. D. 38 años D. edad casada  con el padre D. sus tres hijos integra la Alcancía Comunal  Unidos al  Futuro.
Lidia llego atravez D. una vecina  que le invitó a participar en un crédito Grupal y desD. entonces participa junto a las otras 8 socias mas, se inicio en el negocio D.   alquiler D. carros (autos) , Al inicio contaba con un solo vehículo  y al transcurrir el tiempo compro uno más, el ingreso que ella obtenía lo juntaba  para poder ahorrarlo en un nuevo negocio , es D. esa manera que desD. hace 5 años inauguro una Bodega, como en todo negocio  inicio con poca cantidad D. mercadería  como golosinas gaseosa, cerveza, abarrotes, también realiza la venta D. gas,  con el tiempo su ingreso mejoro , este actual préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra D.  un saco D. azúcar, un saco D. arroz , 5 cajas D. cerveza, 5 cajas D. gaseosas D. litro.
Sus planes más adelante es D. abrir en su domicilio un Salón D. Belleza, y lo más importante apoyar en lo que sea necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia V. is 38 years old, married and has three children. She belongs to the "Unidos al Futuro" communal bank. Lidia came to the group through a neighbor who invited her to participate in a group loan. Since then, she has participated along with 8 other members and started a business renting cars. In the beginning she only had one vehicle and over time bought another. She saved the income she received so she could open a new business and 5 years ago started up a package store. Like with any business, she started out with a small quantity of merchandise, such as candy, beer, groceries. She also sold gas. Over time her revenue improved. This loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, 5 cases of beer and 5 cases of 1-liter soft drinks. Her plans for the future are to open a beauty salon in her home and more importantly, to proviD. for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette  femme est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2002 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé  où ce commerce est très développé ; afin de toucher une plus grande  clientèle elle exerce son commerce de façon  ambulante. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a su bien remboursé ; elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour acheter 4 pièces de pagnes GTP, 15 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, et 4 pièces de pagnes Wax hollandais.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic. To generate income she has a business selling "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics). She began in 2002, and she gets her supplies at the big market in Lomé, where this commerce thrives. In order to reach the largest number of customers, she conducts business as an itinerant vendor. She received a loan from WAGES which she was able to repay in full. She is seeking a third loan to buy 4 GTP pagnes, 4 Hitarget pagnes, and 4 "Wax hollandais" pagnes (the names refer to fabric quality and motif).

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pagnes

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia D. C., a widow at 55, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has a child who is struggling through his high school years.  By the grace of God, Leticia has managed to support her child’s schooling by herself.  At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. A dream for most poor Filipino parents like Leticia as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Leticia operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. It is also packed hot into a Styrofoam box and sold in the streets, mostly recognized by the honking of the bicycle boy who carries and sells them. Leticia’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Leticia hopes that her business will be successful one day, enough for her to buy her own house, lot, and car for her retirement.

loans.use: buying raw ingredients for bread production

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin T., from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 33 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Marvin owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials needed to provide service, he is now requesting his second loan in the amount of 8000 PHP to purchase materials needed for the motorcycle maintenance. Marvin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for his motorcycle maintenance business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita M. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 41 years old. Juanita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Juanita is just starting this business.

In 2007, Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Juanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina ha vendido ropa, cosméticos, joyería y perfumes desde hace 7 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Luz Marina comenzó su negocio cuando su pareja la dejó y ella tuvo que encontrar una manera de mantenerse, pues no ha sido fácil pero con la ayuda necesaria y con la buena administración que aplica a su actividad son la clave para su éxito. Este financiamiento es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, lápiz labial entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina has been selling clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, and perfume for seven years. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan. Luz Marina began her business when her partner left her, and she had to find a way to support herself. It has not been easy, but having the necessary help and her good business management skills are the keys to her success. This loan is for the purchase of perfume, creams, cosmetic treatments, and lip pencils, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. is 33 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher and they have two children aged 17 and 14. Her business is located at Mwingi in a very busy market and is served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. 

Juliana owns a mobile phone charging business well known by the name 'Biafra Mobile Charging'. Besides the mobile phone charging business, she sells clothes and juice. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that in some seasons, business is slow leading to low sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes and juice to expand her business. 

In future, she hopes to open her own boutique as well as selling phones. She describes herself as patient, responsible, hardworking and jovial.

loans.use: To buy clothes and juice to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn V. is 35 years old and the mother of two children. In 2008, she joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines. She is excited as she recalls all her experiences as a mother and a member of ASHI. Before joining ASHI, she remembers how hard it was to start a business, especially without having access to capital. Her prayer was granted when she became a member of the institution and started taking loans. She started earning and can regularly provide their basic needs. She is applying again for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy additional grocery items, soft drinks and raw products for her food vending business. She wishes to expand her food vending business because she notices the increase of customers eating in her place. She plans to establish a more convenient place for her customers to eat and add more menus for them to choose from. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will support her future plans.

loans.use: To buy raw products for her food vending business and additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Sabina Alejandra

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos, el primero tiene 19 años y la última 13 años todos están estudiando, pero el mayor de sus hijos trabaja y estudia a la vez.
Sabina se dedica ala venta de abarrotes en general (fósforo, aceite, fideos, harina, gelatina, conservas, orégano, sal, arroz, azúcar. etc) en el Mercado Las Nazarenas, al iniciar su negocio comenzó con un capital de S/.300.00 y vendía molidos ajos, ají rojo, ají amarillo, etc., todo para aderezos, no tenia un puesto fijo por ello vendía en distintos lugares ya que era ambulante. Ella menciona que gracias a la préstamo que obtuvo de Finca pudo incrementar su capital y cambiar de negocio. 
La meta de Sabina es poder hacer crecer su negocio. Ella menciona que  la única dificultad que tuvo en su negocio es cuando se accidento pero actualmente no tiene ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Paloma” (Dove). She is divorced and the mother of three children. The oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest is 13. All of them are students, but the oldest works and studies part-time. Sabina sells groceries (matches, oil, noodles, flour, gelatin, preserves, oregano, salt, rice, sugar, and other products) at the Nazarene Market. She started her business with start-up capital of 300 PEN and sold crushed garlic, red pepper, yellow pepper, and other spices used for seasoning. Sabina did not have an established vending post, so she sold in different places as a traveling merchant. She says that thanks to the loan she obtained from FINCA, she was able to increase her capital and switch to another business.

Sabina’s goal is to grow her business. She mentions that the only problem she encountered with her business was when she was injured, but now she has no difficulties.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar in bulk

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba de 32 años de edad,  labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 5 años,  es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 7 añitos de edad, el mayor esta cursando su sexto grado de primaria y el menor estudia su segundo grado de educaciòn primaria, Elba es una mujer que ha luchado para que sus hijos no les falte nada a pesar que no recibe la ayuda del padre de sus hijos, les garantiza lo basico; es bien querida por sus alumnos y padres de familia.                                                                                          solicita su segundo crèdito para poner verjas al porche de la vivienda con el objetivo de que sus niños no se salguen a la calle cuando ella no se encuentre, tambien le va brindar mayor seguridad a su casa, es importante mencionar que esta clienta solamente ha trabajado con Afodenic, no tiene crèdito en ningun lugar y ha sido bien cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.  

Su mayor sueño es brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos y prepararlos profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Elba, 32, has been employed as a Teacher at Mauricio Cajina School for the last five years.  She is a single mother of two children who are 11 and 7 years of age.  The oldest is in sixth grade and the youngest is in second grade in elementary school.

Elba is a woman who has fought so that her children lack nothing even though she gets no support from the children’s father.  She makes sure to provide them with the basics.  She is well liked by her students and their parents.

She is asking for her second loan to install metal grates on her house’s porch so that her children won’t go out into the street when she’s not home.  This will also provide better security to her home.

It’s important to mention that this client has only worked with Afodenic.  She does not have any loans any place else and she has met her monthly repayment obligations quite well.

Her dream is to provide the best for her children and to prepare them professionally.

loans.use: To install metal grates on her house.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta tiene 30 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron las técnicas de la agricultura, es por eso que cuando se casó y formó su propia familia no dudo en ayudar a su esposo en el sustento del hogar y empezó junto con él a sembrar maíz en grandes cantidades. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo ya que es la única actividad que sabe como se realiza, además que le proporciona buenas ganancias, pues el maíz que cosecha lo vende a un molino de la zona y con ello obtiene capital asegurado, sin embargo para alcanzar tener una buena cosecha de maíz es de mucho dedicación y trabajo; pero eso no la detiene por que sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa. Como es una mujer muy laboriosa que siempre se proyecta al futuro, tiene planeado sembrar otros vegetales en sus tierras. Es su tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de abono para su campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Marta, 30, lives with her husband and two children in her own home.  When she was still very young her parents taught her how to farm.  So, when she got married and formed her own family she didn’t hesitate to help her husband support the home and started to help him plant corn in large quantities.

She enjoys farming very much because it’s the only work she knows how to do.  Besides, it’s quite profitable because the corn she harvests she sells to a local mill so her income is steady.  However, in order to get a good corn crop much dedication and hard work are required.  This doesn’t stop her, though, because she knows that all effort brings its own reward.  Because she is a hard working woman she’s always looking to the future.  She plans to plant other vegetables on her land.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial help and enjoys being part of a communal bank because all its members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She thanks all the people who will fund her loan because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use it to buy manure for her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Joie

texts.en:
Mrs. Joie L. is from the Barangay of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 34 years-old and married to Prescillano L.. They are blessed with three children all of whom are now of school age. To make a living, they have a business buying, selling and roasting pigs. They’ve been engaged in this kind of business for one year already.  At present, they earn an amount of not less than Php 1,500.00 per week. 

Just this year, Joie joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joie, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of Php5,000.00 for her first loan which will be used as additional capital for their business buying, selling and roasting pigs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family particularly in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide capital for their pig business.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Tenocra

texts.en:
Tenocra Y. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Malis, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and copra (dried coconut meat). Her husband Alvin Y., who is 31 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 1 year old. 

Tenocra joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tenocra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, with which she intends to buy inventory of general store products so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her only child. She also hopes that it will improve her business. Tenocra Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela Rosa D. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien desde muy joven empezó a trabajar. Ella inicio un pequeño negocio hace  varios años tiene una pequeña y modesta pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación en el barrio San Judas.
Ella invertirá el crédito en gaseosa, aceite, arroz, pollo, carne, cerdo, perecederos, lácteos, cloro, jabón, detergente.
texts.en: Ángela Rosa D. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who started to work at a very young age. She started a small business a few years ago. She has a small and modest corner store in her home in the San Judas neighbourhood. She will invest this loan in pop, oil, rice, chicken, meat, pork, perishables, dairy products, bleach, soap and detergent.

loans.use: for pop, oil, rice, chicken, meat, pork, perishable goods, milk products, bleach, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Lydia has a business selling clothes, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. O. is a married man. His wife is a business-lady and they have seven children aged between twenty-nine years old and fifteen years old. He owns a bicycle which he uses to provide transport services. His target market is comprised of fishmongers in the area, ice bar suppliers and other local walk-in customers. He is located at the heart of Kisumu Municipal Fish Market where there are many people thus many customers to serve. 

George has been in business for seven years now. His business is profitable, but his major challenge is financial constraints. He also says that during the rainy season business is usually low because many people prefer closed vehicles since they are sheltered from cold and rain. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He plans to use his loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a motorbike which will do more business for a longer time since it is more durable than a bicycle.

He sees himself growing his business and imparting business skills to young people so that they can be able to better their lives. He describes himself as humble, motivated and kind.

loans.use: Motorbike

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos S. has been a farmer for a long time. She lives in the Phnom Penh city. She cultivates rice crops on her farmland to earn income. Her husband helps her in the farming business. 

Sos S. has six children, most of them are employed in a variety jobs, and they often share their profit with her to help her with family expenses.  Sos S. would like to request a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her children, who must always hire motor taxis to travel to their job locations.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana G. V.:es de 55 años de edad,vive con su hija junto con su nieta,ella nos cuenta que tiene mucha experiencia en ventas, ya que desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su madre a vender,ella nos cuenta que inicio haciendo costuras y vendiendo comida de casa en casa despues puso una tortilleria con la cual pudo construir su casa, actual mente tiene una tienda donde vende productos comestibles de primera nacesidad,como frijol,arroz,maiz,azucar,etc su sueño es poder tener otra tienda para aumentar su capital y asi estar bien economicamente y asi poder ayudar a su hija y su nieta solicita este credito para compra de productos comestibles como,  frijol,arroz,maiz,azucar,
etc. ella espera que Fape le pueda ayudar con su credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Estefana G. V., age 55, lives with her daughter and her granddaughter.  She tells us that she has a lot of experience in sales.  When she was very young she helped her mother sell.  She tells us that she started sewing and selling food door to door.  After that she established a tortilla business, which allowed her to build her house.  

She currently has a store where she sells basic needs food products like beans, rice, corn, and sugar, etc.  Her dream is to be able to have another store in order to increase her capital.   That way she would be alright financially, and she would be able to help her daughter and her granddaughter.

She will use the loan to buy food products like beans, rice, corn, and sugar, etc.  She hopes that Fape is able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: To buy food products like beans, rice, corn, and sugar

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J. is from the village of Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is now requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Norma’s 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Richar

texts.es: Richar, de 32 años natural del distrito de San Francisco, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador convive con Luisa de 25 años, juntos tienen 02 hijos Juan de 03 años y Luis de 01 año de edad y juntos viven en su propia casa. Richar, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 10 años de manera independiente; espacio donde cultiva café y hojas de coca; en total posee 04 hectáreas y media de terreno. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto, de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver los frutos bien desarrollados, en consecuencia obtiene buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido. Asimismo menciona que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en ese tiempo abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias, impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando a los frutos de sus plantaciones. Richar piensa ingresar a otro tipo de negocio e invertir sus ahorros y más el dinero que le facilitó la institución MFP, para así incursionar en la venta de electrodomésticos. Mas adelante tiene pensado comprar nueras tierras y sembrar plantas de barbasco, ya que los inversionistas coreanos empezaran a tratar estas plantas en las tierras del distrito de Santa Rosa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. A la vez se siente muy comprometido con la institución por  proporcionarle el crédito. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará electrodomésticos porque este será su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Richar, 32, is from San Francisco District.  He is a cheerful, hard working young man living together in his own house with Luisa, 25, and their two children: Juan, 3 and Luis, 1.

Richar started his farming adventure while still a child in his parents’ fields.  His passion for agriculture led him to acquire his own land where he’s been working independently for ten years.  He farms coffee and coca leaf.  In total, he has four and a half hectares of land.

During harvest time he hires laborers to help with the work in order extract the most fruit quickly and get ahead faster.  He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his daily efforts he is able to see his fruit develop well which leads to good profits on every kilogram sold.

In addition, he mentions that he does not much enjoy the winter season because insects abound and rain is frequent which impedes his work and damages fruit.

Richar plans to start a new kind of business and invest his savings plus the money he got from MFP to start selling home appliances.  Later on he plans to buy more land to plant barbasco (hardwood shrub) plants because Korean investors have begun to deal in these plants in the district of Santa Rosa.

This is his first loan with MFP and he’s willing to repay all his installments punctually because he’d like to access another future loan.  At the same time, he feels committed to the institution because it provided the loan.

He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy home appliances because this will be his new business.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Mary Gold

texts.en:
Mary Gold S., 36, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Mary Gold is a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Gold has been raising vegetables for 15 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Gold would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 49 years old and married with two children aged 28 and 26. She owns a farming business in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Jessica grows rice and sells her harvest to her town's market. Jessica works hard to provide for the needs of her household. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Jessica hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba O. sells (as a peddler) kid's clothes, slippers, and other items at Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been trading in this type of business for three years. She supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will serve as in increase in income to buy more clothes, slippers, and shoes for resale. She anticipates reinvesting her additional profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, slippers, and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marissa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to purchase another fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri comes from village Tkhilnari, West Georgia. He is 40 years old, married and lives with his family – his wife Shorena, their 10-year-old daughter and his parents. Badri works as a night-watchmen in a local stone factory and TV station. He gets a salary for his job. Besides the above-mentioned, Badri and Shorena earn income from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.5 ha of agricultural land, where various fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. 

Also they have a milk cow and sell cheese. Along with all that, Badri has 60 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Twice a year they get honey from the beehives and sell it on the local market. The total monthly income of the family is approximately 2,000 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Badri will purchase additional bee-hives and bee-colonies. He will get more honey and sell it on the local market. This will positively impact the income of the family. The increase in income will be used for financing their child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.name: Catherine Carmen

texts.es: Catherine nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú). Actualmente, Catherine vive en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y es profesora de música. Ya son varios años que se dedica a esta profesión y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella dicta clases particulares de piano, violín, canto, percusión y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Catherine requiere el préstamo para implementar una academia de musica. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Catherine was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru) and currently lives in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She is 35 years old, married, and a music teacher.  She has been in this profession for several years and her work is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into it.  Catherine gives private piano, violin, singing and percussion lessons.  She has a small studio in her home.

On this occasion, Catherine needs a loan to set up a music school.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

loans.use: to set up a music school

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Maputo Sul de Moçambique, tem 23 anos de idade é solteiro e não tem filho. Encontra se a frequentar a 9ª classe, não concluiu antes, devido ao horario do seu trabalho, responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive na cidade de Maputo. Consegue poupar 500.00mt mensalmente.

Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha alegando que ia passar ferias  escolares em casa do tio, por ventura o seu tio consegue aranjar um emprego e ele começa a trabalhar e deixa os estudos. Hoje é funcionario permanente ha mais de 3 anos trabalha como fachineiro auferindo mensalmente 2.700.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa, mas também tem feito trabalhos de instalação electica nas casas ainda em construção.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar  material de construção para dar continuidade da sua obra. Os anteriores de 4.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt foram para a mesma finalidade. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um outro para concluir as minimas partes da sua obra.
texts.en:
Sergio was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is 23, single, and doesn't have children.  He is currently taking ninth grade classes.  He didn't finish school before due to his work schedule.  He is also financially responsible for his mother who lives in the city of Maputo.  He saves 500 meticals each month.

He moved to the district of Namaacha to spend a school holiday at his uncle's house.  Luckily his uncle arranged employment for him and he began to work and stopped going to school.  Today he has worked full time as a cleaner for more than 3 years.  He makes 2,700 meticals a month that he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also does electrical work in houses that are under construction.

This is his third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticals that he will use to buy construction materials to continue work on his house.  His previous loans were for 4,000 and 10,000 meticals that also went towards his home.  He is confident that he will pay back his loan on time and ask for another one to finish the final details of his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married lady and a mother of four adult-aged children. She is 51 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rosa has a food vending business to earn a living. She also has a second business in retail. She sells freshly prepared food by peddling in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 7,000 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients for food preparation.

Rosa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Rosa hopes to gain more income so that she can establish a food stall in the town.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 41 years old and lives in airport community.  She stopped her education in the ninth grade.  She is single and has eight children between 16 and 35 years old; four are in school and the others are work in the market with her.  After the death of her husband, she started her business with the little amount that was left.  Some of the problems she faces is the rainy season.  She is requesting a loan to purchase coal bags and charcoal for her business.  Her plan is to build her warehouse for the coal and to send her chilren to school and to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase coal bags and charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 45 years old, married, and has two children aged 7 and 9. He is a grocer and sells cabbage to all types of customers near his home. He has been running this business for over 25 years. In addition to selling cabbage, Edward also farms. He intends to use his loan to add more stock. 

Edward hopes to keep expanding his business. He dreams of becoming a cabbage wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more cabbage.

loans.name: Celia Mabel

texts.es: Celia de 24 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como ropa de cama, de baño, de cocina entre otras. Ella es casada y tiene una hija en la edad de un año. Cuando inició su negocio hace dos años, fue apoyada por su suegra, negociante vinculada también a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, quien le dio mercancía para que  se dedicara al comercio y ganara dinero; gradualmente con este primer impulso y su trabajo disciplinado, logró hacer su propio capital y extenderse un poco más; ahora vende a crédito a vecinas, familiares, amigos y referidos por su clientela base y vive entusiasmada en hacer crecer su negocio y apoyar la gestión de su familia con sus ingresos, porque su mayor desafío es lograr para su hija una educación de calidad que la conduzca a ser exitosa. Mientras esto ocurre maneja buenos indicadores financieros de acuerdo a su actividad y un gran potencial de crecimiento con el que planea, pasar de una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 45% a una superior mediante inyecciones de capital de trabajo, para aumentar sus posibilidades de responder oportunamente a su clientela. Esto es lo que justamente se propone con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará cubrelechos, sabanas, toallas, y artículos de lencería, inversión exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos en la víspera de la celebración del mes del amor y de la amistad, fecha en la cual amigos, familiares y parejas expresan sus sentimientos mediante obsequios, que en este caso Celia venderá.
texts.en:
Celia is 24 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena. She sells various types of merchandise such as bed sheets, bath towels, kitchen linens, and other items. Celia is married and has a one-year-old daughter. When she started her business two years ago, Celia received help from her mother-in-law, a businesswoman who has also partnered with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and provided her with merchandise to start her retail business. Celia earned a profit from her first few sales and gradually developed discipline in her work. She was able to acquire her own capital and expand her business a little more. Now she sells on credit to neighbors, relatives, friends, and referrals from her existing customers. Celia is excited about growing her business and supporting her family with her income because her greatest challenge is providing her daughter an education that is of good quality so that she can become successful.

Meanwhile, she is able to maintain good financial indicators in accordance to her business activity and her potential for growth. She plans to achieve profitability from her sales at a rate of 45% with greater injections of operating capital, which will increase the likelihood that she can respond to her customers in a timely manner. This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Domingo. Celia will use the money to buy bedspreads, bed sheets, towels, and lingerie. She expects to have a successful investment because of the orders she receives in celebration of the month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day), a time in which friends, relatives, and couples express their feelings by exchanging gifts. Celia plans to make sales during this time.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed sheets, towels, and lingerie.

loans.name: Marub

texts.ru:
Маруб умный и добрый человек. Он женат и у них 5 детей. Он занимается купля продажей скота. Он начал свой бизнес с разведением овца. Данный бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, и он хочет расширить этот бизнес. Прибыль, который он получил от данного бизнеса, дал ему возможность проводит свадебных мероприятий и покрыт семейные расходы. В данный момент он имеет 4 голов коров и 3 голов барана. Маруб хотел бы получит займ для покупки скота, с целью расширения бизнеса.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Marub is a smart and kind person.  He is married and has five children.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock.  He started his business with breeding sheep.  The current business brings him a good income, and he wants to expand this business.  The profits from this business gave him an opportunity to hold weddings and cover family expenses.  Currently, he has four cows and three sheep.  Marub wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand his business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 37 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro  D. educación secundaria.
La señora desD. siempre se ha dedicado a la venta D. abarrotes, también viaja a la ciudad D. Arequipa llevando detergentes y shampoo.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza D. chanchos.  DesD. hace tres ciclos trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos diversos para vender en la ciudad D. Arequipa, como gaseosas al por mayor.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil en la ciudad D. Arequipa.
La señora desea tener más capital y comprarse un carro para ofrecerlo en servicio y generar otros ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the La Yunguyeñita Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Yunguyo and the Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has six children. She completed up to her third year of secondary school.

Florencia has always worked selling groceries and also travels to the city of Arequipa, bringing detergents and shampoo. At the same, she also works raising pigs. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles and her most recent loan was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she invested in her grocery business.

With this new loan of 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase a variety of products to sell in the city of Arequipa, including wholesale soft drinks. Her children and husband, who works as a builder in the city of Arequipa, help her with the business. Florencia would like to have more capital to buy a car to offer services, thus generating additional income.

One thing she likes about the communal bank is the loan facility and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks and other products.

loans.name: Geoffery

texts.en: Geoffrey is a single man. For the last three years, he has been making bricks to make a living. He also does motorbike transport to earn extra income. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a moulding machine and a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a moulding machine and motorbike.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a farmer in Muranga, Central Kenya. She is aged 71 and married with eight adult children. She has been in farming for 40 years, producing milk, honey, coffee and fish.

Cecilia has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter in order to ease her dairy animals' feeding. She believes this will make the feeding of her dairy animals better, make them more productive and significantly reduce her feeding costs. She adds that the income will improve her living standards together with her family.

She is full of praise for Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Kyanya Bakyara Thuwathikana Group

texts.en: Eddy is a 45 year-old married woman with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail and foodstuffs business for ten years. She started with 500,000 shillings, and now has 1,500,000 shillings in working capital. Eddy needs this loan to buy rice, beans, and soap to sell. Her hardships are debtors and high transport costs, and her vision is to expand her business and to educate her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha y tambien vende jora que es un insumo que se usa para preparar la chicha,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de chicha . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y fideos al por mayor y tambien para comprar jora para preprara la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Florencia is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She continues running her grocery store business. She sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She also continues selling chicha (a corn-based drink) and jora corn which is an ingredient used in making chicha. Florencia would like to expand and improve her grocery store business and her chicha business. She is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale, and also to buy jora corn for preparing her chicha. Florencia is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale, and to buy jora corn for making chicha

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora tiene 71 años, es de la ciudad de Concepción, vive con una de sus hijas y un nieto. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de producto de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, harina, panificados y demás artículos, con lo cual provee a todos los vecinos de su barrio.
Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y gracias a eso puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su casa y de esa forma poder salir adelante. Comenta que su  hija le ayuda en su negocio, pues hay días que tiene muchos clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, harina, panificados y demás artículos de primera necesidad con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad para sus clientes. Aurora está muy agradecida por la ayuda que fundación paraguaya y kiva le ha dado.
texts.en:
Aurora is 71 years old and from the city of Concepción.  She lives with one of her daughters and a grandson.  Aurora has a business selling basic household products such as sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other items, which she supplies to all her neighbors.

Aurora comments that she has many customers and, as a result, she can make the income she needs to cover her household expenses and, in this way, get ahead in life.  She comments that her daughter helps her in her business as there are days when she has many customers.

Aurora is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other basic household products with which she can stock her store and offer her customers more variety.  Aurora is very grateful for the help that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other items

loans.name: Dunia Elisabett

texts.es:
La señora Dunia tiene 40 años de edad y vive en la Colonia Los Torres en el municipio de Choloma.  Ella vive con su pareja Rubén. Dunia tiene una hija de 11 años de edad, la cual está estudiando. 

Doña Dunia trabajaba en una maquila pero hace 3 años ella quiso independizarse y trabajar en su propio negocio. Inició una pulpería donde trabaja 14 horas diarias vendiendo productos de la canasta básica y de primera necesidad y recargas electrónicas. 

Solicitó este crédito de L15,000 para la compra de productos alimenticios para surtir su negocio. Ella espera crecer en el negocio y mejorar la nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Dunia is 40 years old and resides in the subdivision of Los Torres in the town of Choloma. She lives with her partner Rubén. Dunia has an 11-year-old daughter who is in school.

Doña Dunia worked at a factory, but three years ago she decided to become independent and work in her own business. She started a grocery store where she works 14 hours a day. Dunia sells household products, basic necessities, and rechargeable phone cards.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL in order to buy food products to restock her business. Dunia hopes to grow her business and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various food products.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José es sociólogo, trabaja como consultor en una de las Universidades Públicas de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para compra de llantas y reparación de su movilidad ya que las consultorías que realiza son fuera de ciudad. José es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa alquilada  ubicada en la zona  de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. José is a sociologist who works as a consultant at one of the public universities in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tires and repair his vehicle for when he has to travel out-of-town for consultations. José is single and has no children. He lives in a rented house in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana  is a widow with four children. For the past eight years, she has been a small trader at Ankwanda near Elmin. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and care for her children.   

Nana is requesting a loan to purchase sachet water to sell. With the profits from her loan she wishes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: purchase sachet water to sell

loans.name: Proyectandonos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Proyectándonos” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, preparación de comida rápida, preparación de comida típica, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Juan Carlos presidente del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al final del grupo, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta color rojo y usa su cabello corto.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años y desde hace un año, trabaja de manera estable en un local, ahí cuenta con permiso y patente. 
Además se dedica al rubro de la gastronomía, ya que Juan Carlos es Chef de profesión. Cuenta con un local, donde presta servicios de banquetería, a través del cual fomenta la comida típica de la zona.
Su mercadería la compra en importadoras en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para surtir su negocio. El resto del dinero lo ahorrará para cumplir una de sus metas. La cual es habilitar una cadena de locales de gastronomía.
Juan Carlos contraerá matrimonio durante el mes de febrero del año 2012, comenta que se siente muy contento.
El está muy agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
El grupo del Banco comunal es muy comprometido y responsable con cada uno de sus negocios.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Proyectándonos” and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who run different businesses among which are: clothes making, fast food preparation, and others. They all belong to the city of Puerto Montt.

Juan Carlos is the president of the bank and appears in the photo at the end of the group, the third person from right to left, wearing a red jacket and short hair. He has sold used clothes for the last 3 years and for the last year has been in a fixed locale for which he has the requisite permits and licenses. He is also involved in gastronomy as by profession Juan Carlos is a chef. He has premises where he offers banqueting services through which he promotes the local food of the area. He buys his merchandise at importers in the city of Santiago. 

With the loan he will buy clothes to stock his business. The rest of the money he will save so as to attain one of his goals, which is to start a local food chain.

Juan Carlos will get married in February 2012 and he says that he is very happy. 

He is very grateful for the opportunity given him by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow him to invest in his business. His communal bank group is committed and responsive to each of the businesses.

Puerto Montt is a city in southern Chile, located in the region of Los Lagos. One of the attractions of Puerto Montt is its beautiful green landscapes, its unfrequented beaches, cuisine and especially its reputation for seafood and handicrafts. It is also the gateway to the Isla Grande de Chiloe, rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is 48 years old and is married to Kalondu.  They have 5 children. He has been running a hotel business for the last 2 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8900.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000.  He intends to use the funds to purchase stocks of cooking oil ,sugar and wheat flour for the hotel business.  With the anticipated profit, he will grow his business and diversify into farming.

His hopes and dreams are to do both hotel and farming.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cooking oil, sugar, and wheat flour for the hotel

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne Cécile est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne Cécile est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne Cécile est mariée à un chargeur du nom de Épiphane. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et un à leur charge. Jeanne Cécile vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jeanne Cécile vend des bijoux comme activité principale. Parallèlement à cette activité, Jeanne Cécile vend des produits de beauté. Jeanne Cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeanne Cécile ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des bijoux.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Баходур  трудолюбивый пожилой мужчина  в возрасте  46  лет. Он женат и имеет двое замечательных детей. Они  живут  в  сельском  районе.  Его жена  Озода.  Она домохозяйка и ухаживает  за детьми.  Они живут душа в душу. Он занимается земледелием. Вот уже на протяжении 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур.
 Так как они живут в сельской местности , дождей бывает много и  из крыши домов их проникает вода. В данное время Баходур вместе со своей женой хотят отремонтировать свой дом, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания, но  собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Баходур обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zhalilov Bahodur Sulaimonovich is 46 years old.  He lives in the jamoat (commune) of Sarazm.  His wife, Sattorova Ozoda, is a homemaker.  Bahodur has two children.  He works in farming.  He wants to receive a loan of 2,500 somoni from MDO Arvand to buy some slate.  He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building matirials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start business

loans.name: Félicia

texts.en:
Félicia D. was born on April 14, 1967 in Gapé-Nyita (in Zio prefecture), a village located 6 km from Gapé-Centre. She is married and the mother of seven children, who depend on her entirely. Her husband is unemployed and has absolutely no financial resources. Ms. D. raises goats and sheep that are free-ranging in the village, and so the animals roam unrestrained at the risk of being injured or lost. For the purposes of constructing a new corral to better watch over the animals, she has resorted to borrowing $500. Since she seems to be a moral person with an attitude of a good livestock breeder, she would be able to repay her loan easily.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Félicia est née le 14 avril 1967 à Gapé- Nyita dans le Zio, village distant de six kilomètres de Gapé-Centre. Elle est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants qui sont à sa charge. Son mari est sans emploi et n’a aucun moyen financier. Son élevage des chèvres et de moutons se fait à l’air libre dans le village et les bêtes errent librement avec pour conséquence des dégâts et pertes. En vue de construire un nouvel enclos pour pouvoir mieux surveiller ses bêtes, elle fait recours à un prêt de $500. Présentant une bonne moralité et une attitude d’un bon éleveur, elle pourrait rembourser facilement son crédit.

loans.use: To build a pen to raise goats and sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Testimony: "My eagerness to contribute to my family and community has encouraged me and my friends to work together as a group. Today, I am proud of having a positive contribution at both levels: family and community. My opinion can be heard in our community."

Business: Shoe Seller

Family: A married woman with five children

Current Income: I have an average income of $45.00 per month.

Business Plan: I want to secure a shop were I can stock my goods for sell instead of going from place to place.

This is a group loan that Mrs. Mary belongs to called Gaskiya Cooperative.

loans.use: To rent a small shop and enlarge her stock of general use items.

loans.name: Boung

texts.en:
Mrs Boung P. is 21 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman and earns fivedollars a day. They have three children who are still students. 
Mrs Boung P. wants to expand her husband's business. She is requesting a loan to buy a small boat and some fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Osamede

texts.en: Osamede A. is 30 years old and a dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in sales of provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for people in her community. She hopes to improve her business with the loan of $250 by buying more stock. She a is married woman with 5 children and has been in this business since 1997.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima lives in the Bekaa with her husband and 4 children. There is nothing Fatima cannot do. She is a mother, a wife, a tailor and a business woman. She contacted Al Majmoua because she needs a loan to buy material for her tailoring work.  Fatima doesn't limit herself to this business. She also sells various items like soft drinks, juices etc. Maybe Fatima doesn't realize it yet, but she is a great example illustrating women's active participation in the social and economic lives of their communities.

loans.use: To buy material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade is 25 years old and a mother of one child, aged 6. She began her business before joining MBK. Through her business, she sells gasoline to the community. Ade can earn up to $5 per day. Her husband, Iwan, is a private school teacher who earns $60 per month.

Ade requests IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) so she can buy more gasoline to sell. She hopes to earn more income to help cover the family's daily needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
I am Rubina M. from a small town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and mother of five, all of them below 12. Three of my kids attend school whereas two are small and stay at home.

My husband has a scrap business. He is in this business for past ten years. Now he is in the process of expanding his business for which he requires a loan. My group members who need loans are: Sakina I. needs loan to buy a stitching machine, Inayat P. she will invest loan in their vegetables business, Sakina B. needs a loan to invest in her son’s food stall.

loans.use: Expand scrap business

loans.name: Trisilo

texts.id:
To supplement her husband in seeking the necessities of the family, Trisilo tailors clothings. She purchases fabrics from Kumbasari market. She buys several rolls costing Rp 200.000,00 – Rp 300.000,00 (USD22 – USD33)/roll. The cloth will be tailored into clothings and sold for Rp 15.000,00 – Rp 20.000,00 (USD1.60 – USD2) each piece. Each roll of fabric usually makes 30 – 40 pieces of clothing. She sells them in traditional markets with earnings of Rp 800.000,00 (USD87)/month. She also custom tailors traditional woman blouses with a sewing machine.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Demi membantu suaminya untuk mencari nafkah keluarga, Trisilo menekuni usaha Menjahit Baju. Dia membeli kain di Pasar Kumbasari. Dia beli beberapa gulung seharga Rp 200.000,00 - Rp 300.000,00/gulung. Kain tersebut dijadikan baju dengan harga jual Rp 15.000,00 – Rp 20.000,00 per potongnya. Satu gulung kain biasanya menghasilkan 30 – 40 potong baju. Dia menjualnya di pasar – pasar tradisional dengan keuntungan usaha Rp 800.000,00/bulan. Dia ini juga jahit kebaya, sesuai dengan permintaan pelanggan dengan menggunakan mesin jahit..

loans.use: Purchase materials for clothings (Membeli bahan - bahan terutama kain).

loans.name: Rada

texts.en: Rada is from Srebrenica and she is 42 years old. She is married and her husband works in an auto service garage. He earns about 1200 KM monthly. This is her first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 1200 KM ($925), and Rada wants to use it for buying material for sewing. She earns some extra money by sewing, and she intends to expand business in order to earn more money for her household.

loans.use: Buying material for sewing.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera and her husband Vasiliy live in Nikopol, in eastern Ukraine. Vera is a small entrepreneur who rents a facility and has a little photo business where she offers picture printing services and sells various photo accessories. A favorable business location, reasonable prices and a nice arrangement of assorted merchandise are some of the factors that have added to the success of her venture. Vera has been in this trade for 8 years. Currently, her monthly income is about $800. She has about $5000 in inventory.

Vera is well-known as an entrepreneur of integrity and consistency. Her business has grown a lot thanks to high-quality, digital equipment she recently bought and low competition in the area where she works. Vera would like to get a loan to increase the assortment of inventory she has for sale in her store. She hopes to invest some of her generated profits into repairs on her house and to purchase some household appliances.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Safua Siolo
