texts.en:
Safua is a married mother of seven children. She is a very hard-working woman in her family. She performs various tasks that she knows she can earn money from, and one of them is her canteen business. She sells her goods at the village school and in her village too.

With her first loan, she bought ingredients and materials needed for running her fast foods stall business. The profits from her business support the financing of her children’s school fees and her other family daily needs.

The SPBD loan is her only available source of capital. She augments her income by also selling vegetables from time to time. She plans a long relationship with SPBD.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and goods for her fast food stall

loans.name: Asimjon

texts.ru:
Asimjon M. lives in the town of Yavan. He lives together with his family. He has 3 children. He has been in agriculture for the last 7 years. He owns his own land where he grows wheat. In order to obtain good quality crops, it is crucial to take care of the plants and add natural fertilizers. Natural fertilizers generally cost more and require additional funds. For this reason, he is seeking to obtain a loan so he could purchase the fertilizers. He lans to pay off the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Маджидов Азимджон житель города Яван. Проживает со своей семьей. У него трое детей. Уже семь лет как он занимается сельским хозяйством. Он имеет дехканское хозяйство , где выращивает пшеницу. Для того . чтобы получить качественный урожай ухаживать за растениями нужно вовремя, удобрять качественными удобрениями . Покупка минеральных удобрений требует больших финансовых затрат. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить удобрения. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Lum Rophina

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Rophina is married and has nine children. She is proud that she and her husband were married in a traditional ceremony, to which she attributes their good luck that they were blessed with so many children. Unfortunately, her husband is now seriously ill and Rophina must care for him and her children alone.

With her previous loans from GHAPE, Rophina succeeded in growing and providing her community with cassava and ndjamadjama (huckleberry leaves, a popular green vegetable). Given this loan, she plans to buy fresh manure, seedlings, and fertilizers to expand and improve her farming. She also intends to buy piglets to fatten and sell for food. She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings, manure, and payment of labour

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is from the Quinua District located an hour away from the city of Ayacucho. She is a separated, 32-year-old mother of two children. Nelly lives in her parents' house, but does not have the help of her children's father. She has a store where she sells groceries, fruit, and drinks. Furthermore, Nelly has a car used for public transportation with the help of a driver.

Nelly is a member of Los Libertadores Village Bank. She needs a loan of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, beer, detergent, and candies to further expand her business.

Nelly's dream is to construct her house, to have another car, and that her children may become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, beer, detergent, and candies

loans.name: Aminata Paulo's Dhahabu Group

texts.en:
Aminata P., age 32, is married with two boys ages 7 and 10. Aminata sells honey and chicken door-to-door in the Kimara area. She has been engaged in this business for four years and works daily from 8am to 6pm. Twice a month, she heads to the Tabora region (in the center of Tanzania) to purchase more honey. It takes her 4 days to go to Tabora and purchase supplies. She is able to earn a profit of US$ 259 per month from honey and US$ 172 from selling chicken.

This will be Aminata's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first one to go to Tabora to buy honey and chickens and is intending to use this next loan for the same purpose.

Aminata is part of subgroup B of Dhahabu (meaning "gold" in Swahili). The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Other members of her group sell food and charcoal and one owns a salon. In the picture, Aminata is second from the right in a blue dress.

loans.use: To travel to Tabora to purchase honey and chicken

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées avec en moyenne vingt huit (28) ans et deux (2) enfants vivant dans des foyers monogames et résident toutes dans le quartier filabougou à Ouéléssébougou (Région de koulikoro 2è région du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté et de voisinage.

L’activité dominante du groupe est la vente de fruits et boissons gazeuses non alcoolisées (selon la saison), en plus de cette activité, elles vendent divers articles tel que : le charbon de bois, les vêtements pour nourrissons (chaussures et layettes).

Après plusieurs activités menées à l’individuel sans réussite, elles se sont regroupées pour intégrer le programme de prêt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt.

Avec ce prêt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter 150 kilogrammes de fruits, 60 cannettes de boissons et d’autres divers articles. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place chaque quinze (15) jours auprès des grossistes et vendent en ambulant et au comptant. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice par cycle de 8000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Elles veulent dans les jours à venir, diversifier leur commerce en embrassant la vente des légumes et condiments.
texts.en:
Membership in the Benkadi group is comprised of married women who are on average 28 years old and have two children. They live in monogamous households, all residing in the Filabougou quarter of Ouelessebougou (Koulikoro, Mali). They are known to one another by ties of kinship and proximity. The group’s primary area of endeavor is the sale of fruit and seasonal non-alcoholic carbonated beverages; in addition, they sell a variety of other items, including charcoal and infant clothing (shoes and layettes). After a series of individual setbacks, they formed a group to join the Soro Yiriwaso group loan program and this will be their first loan. With this loan of approximately $55 (25,000 XOF) per member, they intend to buy 150 kilograms of fruit, 60 cans of drinks and various other articles. They do their purchasing from local wholesalers every 15 days and engage in traveling and cash sales. The women in the Benkadi group hope to realize a profit of $17 (8,000 XOF) each every two weeks. They will use these profits to meet the needs of their families. In the days to come they want to diversify their business, branching out into the sale of vegetables and seasonings.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, beverages and a variety of other items

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es soltera, tiene 22 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, vive en el Barrio José Carlos Mariategui, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao,  Puno, y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

A los 19 años de edad empezó a realizar negocios, se dedica a dos actividades, los días sábados vende ropa (llicllas, casacas, mandiles, etc.) y los demás días vende golosinas en la plaza de Conduriri.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 3 cuotas, comprará con S/.65 cinco paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes precios, con S/.50 seis bolsas de dulces, con S/.100 cinco cajas de galletas y con el saldo comprará, chicitos y otros.

Su meta es aumentar su capital y tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucila is single, she is 22 years old and she studied up to grade 11. She lives in Barrio Jose Carlos Mariategui, in the district of Conduiri within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a new member of the Community Bank "Paria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri.

At the age of 19 she started her business. She carries on two businesses: on Saturdays she sells clothing (scarves, jackets, aprons etc.) and the other days she sells snacks at the plaza in Conduiri.

With this loan of S/.500, a loan which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase 5 cases of soft drinks for S/.65, six bags of candies for S/.50, and five boxes of cookies for S/.100. With her earnings she will purchase cheese chips and other items.

Her goal is to increase her capital to have greater earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a professional caterer of indoor and outdoor events. She bakes cakes of different kinds and shapes for her customers.

Helen is 36 years old. She's been in the catering business for the past 3 years.

Helen is asking for a loan amount of 100,000 naira ($850) to purchase more baking equipment and cooking supplies so that she can meet the growing demands of her numerous customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase catering supplies

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en: Olinda is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Olinda is 33 years old and married with two children. She and her husband own a shoe store, located in a gallery on a street near Ayacucho’s central market. She sells shoes for all ages and sporting equipment. Olinda needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sporting goods. Olinda dreams of opening another branch of her store. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Olinda es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Olinda es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Olinda junto a su esposo tienen una zapatería ubicado en una galería que esta en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, vende zapatos para todas las edades y también implementos deportivos. Olinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de artículos deportivos. Olinda sueña con tener otra sucursal, tener una casa en la ciudad de Lima.

loans.use: Buy sporting goods

loans.name: Leyla Isabel

texts.es:
La Empresaria de Nombre Leyla Isabel B. M. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Leyla tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes Esther Marina Blanco tiene la edad de 23 años y trabaja por cuenta propia su otra hija Caren Patricia tiene la edad de 21 años y trabaja por cuenta propia y su otro hijo Adalmar Antonio tiene la edad de 16 años y cursa el 3 año de secundaria, sus esposo labora como bodeguero en una empresa, Doña Leyla tiene los propósitos de darle mejoras a su  humilde vivienda con los ingresos obtenidos ya que Doña Leyla es una persona luchadora que le gusta salir adelante con su familia sus sueños son de tener su propio negocio en su casa de habitación por lo que actualmente ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante sus deseos son que no acabe la ayuda de los diferentes países ya que necesaria para cada uno de los nicaragüenses.

Su actividad económica es la de mercadería en general como es la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 7 años, ella inicia este negocio por una amiga que le dio crédito para vender los productos y mas tarde con la ganancia lograba comprar productos para formar poco a poco su propio negocio por lo que al comienzo no le fue tan fácil distribuir sus productos pero conforme pasaba el tiempo fue que obtuvo su experiencia en este negocio y al ver que le generaba ingresos decidió invertir lo suficiente en el negocio por lo que ahora el motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería y así ofertar mejores productos para cada uno de sus clientes y satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de ellos por lo que la mercadería la compra en los diferentes departamentos del país como Managua y Chinandega.
texts.en:
Leyla Isabel B. M. is 45 years old and she is married. She has 3 children, whose ages are the following: Esther Marina Blanco is 23 years old and works; her other daughter, Caren Patricia, is 21 years old and also works; her son, Adalmar Antonio, is 16 years old and is in the 3rd year of high school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper at a business. Leyla has the goal of improving her humble house with the income she earns because she is a determined person and likes to help her family. Her dream is to have her own business in her home, since she currently sells her products in the street. She hopes that other countries won’t end their help Nicaragua because it is necessary for all Nicaraguans. She sells general merchandise, such as: new clothing, cosmetics, and others. She sells as a street vendor. She has had this business for 7 years. She was able to begin it with a loan from a friend and later she was able to buy products with her earnings. In this way she was able to slowly build up her business. It wasn’t easy to distribute her products in the beginning, but over time she gained experience in the business. When she saw that she was making a profit, she decided to invest what was necessary in the business. Her motive for requesting a loan is to buy merchandise so she can offer better products to her customers and satisfy demand. She buys the merchandise in different departments of the country, such as Managua and Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Javhar

texts.ru: Джавхар Расулова проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Одна воспитывает сына. Занимается торговлей. Продает национальную одежду, на Китайском рынке.Опыт работы составляет три года. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход. Но она планирует увеличить ассортимент товара путем получения кредита. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов и заработать больше. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 7 месяцев.
texts.en:
Javhar R. lives in Kugran-Tube. She raises a son. For 3 years, Javhar sells national clothing at a Chinese market. Her business brings a good profit, but Javhar wants to take a loan to finance business expansion. She plans to repay the loan within 7 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gny

texts.en: Mrs. Gny R., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo, Cambodia. She raises and sells poultry, earning about US$1 per day, while her husband works as a motorbike dealer and is able to make US$50 in revenue a day. Gny R. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra inició el negocio por que necesitaba un ingreso extra que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Comenzó el negocio en febrero de 1998 vendiendo refrescos y frituras afuera de su casa, ahora tiene una tienda mas grande y surtida

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para adquirir más mercancía le permitirá tener un mayor inventario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Petra began her business because she needed extra income to help her husband with family expenses. She started to operate in 1998 selling soft drinks and fried snaks from her home. Now she has a larger and better stocked store. She needs 4000 pesos, which she will pay back in 10 bi-weekly installments, to buy merchandise that will allow her to increase her store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Mr. Narin K., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Chamroeun Srey, 44, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their daughters is a garment factory worker, three children are in school and the youngest son is still young.

Narin has been a mason for seven years. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Narin doesn’t have enough construction tools for his business so he is asking for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchases and to buy a new cart to carry his construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and to buy a new cart to carry construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema M., 32, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 270 Tala. SPBD loans are Ema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase wire, knapsack sprayer, chemicals, pipes, etc

loans.name: Katuma B Asimwe Annet Group

texts.en: A. Annet is 30 years old. She is married and has three children; two of them are studying. She has been buying and selling produce for over three years. She will use this loan to purchase beans, cassava flour, bananas, and millet. She is an active, hard-working woman whose dream is to work hard and prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans, cassava flour, bananas and millet.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es una mujer trabajadora y muy querida en su barrio, a sus 50 años, vive en su propia casa con sus 2 hijos, Vanesa de 27 y Max de 20 años, ella ha luchado mucho para salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Es la administradora de uno de los restaurantes más concurridos de la ciudad de Puno, “El Rancho”, es una quinta muy bien decorada y con ambientes muy agradables, el cual está ubicado a orillas del Lago Titicaca, tiene menús muy surtidos y la comida es muy deliciosa, donde sus clientes no hacen más que alagar el sazón de la cocinera. Luz espera construir un nuevo ambiente, donde pueda brindar servicios de juegos recreativos a sus clientes, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus comensales, es por eso que siempre los atiende muy bien, en los 2 años que lleva en este negocio ha aprendido a trabajar bajo presión, y es justamente eso lo más difícil de su negocio, puesto que siempre trata de satisfacer a todos lo que comen en su restaurante. Luz se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking woman who is much loved in her neighborhood. She is 50 years old, and lives in her own house with her 2 children, Vanesa, 27, and Max, 20. She has worked hard to succeed and improve her life. Luz manages one of the busiest restaurants in the city of Puno, "El Rancho". It is a very well decorated location with a pleasant atmosphere, located on the banks of Lake Titicaca, with a diverse menu and delicious food, where the customers do nothing but compliment the cook's seasoning. Luz hopes to build a new environment, where she can offer recreational games to her customers. Luz's favorite part of the business is taking care of her companions, so she always serves them very well. In the two years she has been running this business, Luz has learned to work under pressure, and this is the hardest part of the business, since she always tries to satisfy everyone who eats in her restaurant. This is Luz's first loan with MFP, and she knows she has to make her payments on time. She is very happy with her community bank, and she is always aware of the agreements among the members. With the thousand soles she has requested, Luz plans to purchase more tables and chairs to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for a restaurant

loans.name: San Ignacio Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Delia L. formed this committee after already being on one before.  She formed this committee with neighbors and friends who live close together.  They intially had 25 members, but lost a few members who moved to Spain.  Despite this loss, they still have a group savings of 3,200,000 Gs or about $700 U$D.  This group has been with the Fundación Paraguaya for over a year and are in their fourth cycle. 

1	Delia L. G.- Plastic sales 
2	Sonia E.-	Clothing sales 
3	Juana O.-	Clothing sales 
4	Miguelina V.-	Fruit sales 
5	Silvina D. S.-	Clothing sales 
6	Benigna B.-	Clothing sales 
7	Isabela E.-	Clothing sales 
8	Merecede B.-	Clothing sales 
9	Elizabeth G.-	Clothing sales 
10	Celina C.-	Used shoe sales 
11	Carolina V.-	Manicure and pedicure 
 12	Maximiana F.- Vegetable sales 
13	Felipa D.	-         Vegetable sales 
14	Esmilce P.-	Clothing sales 
15	Elva C.- 	Cosmetic sales 
16	Benigna C.-	Clothing and shoe sales 
17	Martina Z.- 	Undergarment sales 
18	Maria A.-	Perfume sales 
19	Rosana G.-	Clothing sales 
20	Maria R.-	Small grocery store 
21	Francisca L.-	Fruit sales

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora Jesusa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil Casada, es madre de 2 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la elaboración de artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos soles, con el cual comprará lana acrílica y lana de alpaca para la elaboración de artesanías en miniatura los cuales los vende en las ferias de Acora.

Su mayor  deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes, ella ya cuenta con local.

A ella le gusta la unión que hay entre las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Jesusa belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 49, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Chinchera community in the San Barolomé sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the foundation of her Community Bank. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought wool to make her handicrafts. She now needs a loan for 1,800 PEN to buy acrylic wool and alpaca wool to make her handicrafts in miniature. She sells them in the Acora fairs. Her biggest wish is to have a grocery story, she already has the location. She likes the unity among the members and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and acrylic wool

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 61 years old and married to Joaquin, a tricycle driver, in the beautiful Antique province town of Hamtic. She has five grown children and has supported them over the years through various farming activities and through her husband's business.

This loan of 14,000 Pesos is for hog fattening, a popular business for people in poverty where she is from. She will buy four small piglets, three racks of feed and vitamins for the piglets with her loan. She will then grow them for approximately six months until they are ready for market.

It is her dream to be a successful businesswoman and she believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed and also be able to help her family rise out of poverty.

-Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar M. has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. He began this enterprise six years ago with a starting capital of $100. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, over time he has expanded his business and now it is a family-run business.

Bakhtiyar is married with two children. He has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. Today, Bakhtiyar needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the variety of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2000 US. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Djoma

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants ; elle habite le quartier de Gbeyendi à Lomé. Elle a décidé cette année de se lancer dans la vente de pagnes de qualité pour aider financièrement son mari électricien, à s’occuper de l’éducation de leurs enfants. Elle a fait ce choix parce qu’elle avait appris la coiffure, mais elle n’a  pas pu ouvrir son atelier de coiffure faute de moyens. Elle sollicite donc un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes Super Wax, 20 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, 10 pièces Soso. Elle est convaincue qu’elle réussira dans son projet
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Gbeyendi in Lomé. This year she decided to launch a business selling high quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) in order to financially help her husband, an electrician, take care of the education of their children. She chose this business because having learned the skill of hairdressing, but she could not open her own hairdressing salon, due to lack of funds.

Therefore, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase 25 sets of "Super Wax" brand "pagnes", 20 sets of "Hitarget" brand "pagnes" and 10 sets of "Soso". She is convinced that she will succeed in this business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high-quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth)

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”, del  distrito D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 51                      años D. edad,  ella es casad y vive actualmente con su esposo, tiene 4 hijos solo uno  uno D. ellos vive con ella esto por motivos D. salud los otros ya trabajan y viven lejos D. ella, ella no tiene estudios pero esto no le impidió salir adelante y trabajar en todo ya que hace D. todo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace   muchos  años es una D. las fundadoras D. su Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para adquirir mercadería para trabajos en tejidos D. artesanía como lana, hilos, etc.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 600.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería en ferretería, también se dedica  en tejidos D. artesanía los cuales los lleva a Apurimac, Churin y los venD. al por mayor, en esta época D. año ella esta fabricando coronas ya que se aproxima el día D.  todos los santos  y las venderá al por mayor.

Su mayor sueño es equipar su tienda D. ferretería y aumentar su mercadería en cuanto a tejidos y llevarlos a otros lugares y venderlos al por mayor.

Lo que le gusta D. las reuniones D. su banco comunal son los encuentros entre las socias, la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de articulos de ferreteria.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde A. is from the town of Guipos, Zambo. Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Matilde is married and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Matilde owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Matilde has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Matilde joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Matilde has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Matilde is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Matilde from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La Sra. Asunta Q. tiene 38 años, esta casada con el Sr. Sergio Alba Quiroz 15 años, tienen 2 hijos y una hija los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona, que queda a dos cuadras de su domicilio. Viven en una zona netamente lechera y agricola en una casa propia.

La Sra. Asunta se dedica a la lecheria desde hace mucho tiempo, desde que era muy pequeña, primero ayudaba a su madre con el cuidado del ganado y poco a poco fue aprendiendo y asi logro comprarse su propio ganado lechero. Ella entrega toda su produccion de leche a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos.

Ella requiere el dinero para termimar de construir su vivienda. Asi podra darles a su familia mejor calidad de vida por que la vivienda estara hecha de un mejor material de construccion.
texts.en:
Asunta Q., 38, has been married to Sergio Alba Quiroz for 15 years. They have two sons and a daughter who go to the local school, which is two blocks from their home. They live in an area that is known for its dairy farming and agriculture. She lives in her own house. Asunta has been a dairy farmer for a long time. She has done this since she was a little girl. First, she helped her mother take care of the livestock. Little by little she was learning. That’s how she was able to buy her own dairy cows. She takes all of her milk production to a local milk company that makes all kinds of dairy products. She needs a loan to finish building her house. That way she can give her family a better quality of life. The house will be made of better construction material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction on her house

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Three of her children are currently in school. She enjoys selling goods, a business which provides her with her daily income. She has been selling yams for four years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy yams wholesale from the farmers. This saves her from having to deal with intermediaries who buy from the farmers and then resell the yams at a higher price. She wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk in order to meet the daily demands of her customers, especially as Christmas approaches. She hopes to use part of the profit she earns to support her kids in school, and another part to expand her business. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing yams in bulk

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
la sra. Ana Luisa A. R. tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene una hija adolescente que le ayuda a la fabricacion de las torillas, tambien le ayuda a empacarlas y venderlas en diferntes lugares, Ana se levanta muy temprano para empezar a producir las tortillas, con su hija han logrado sacar adelante este negocio.
en el mes que viene tienen varios encargos de tortillas para eventos y fiestas es por eso que necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima y no quedarse corta con la produccion.
su sueño es ver graduarse a su hija de la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Luisa A. R. is 36 years old. She works making and selling tortillas. She has an adolescent daughter who helps her make the tortillas, and also to package and sell them in various places. Ana gets up very early in the morning to begin making the tortillas, and with her daughter she has managed to succeed in her business. In the coming month, she has various orders for tortillas for events and parties, and because of this she needs the loan to buy more ingredients and to not fall short on her production. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
La señora Armida  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 42 años D. edad y es soltera. Se dedica compra y venta D. ganado.

La señorita Armida estudió primaria completa y  tiene 5 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 1 años atrás, su primer préstamo fue D.  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. ovejas.

Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  D. una vaca lechera.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener 5 vacas lecheras y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su organización son las reuniones y ahorros.
texts.en:
Armida is a member of "24 D. Junio" community bank. She lives in Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno department. She is 42 years old and single. She buys and sells livestock. Armida has primary school education. She has 5 children and has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her first loan was 500 PEN and allowed her to buy sheep. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. Her hope for the future is to have 5 dairy cows and to see her children attain professional careers. What she likes the most about her organization are the meetings and savings accounts.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda D. lives in San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, she just went into business making and selling snacks and other delicacies to people in her local community.

In 2009, Nelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Nelda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make products to sell. This loan, her first from HSPFI, will allow her to generate additional income to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 42 years old.  He is married and has four children. Three of his children are in school and one is learning a trade. George has been a baker who uses flour for his production for the last two years.  He is also a chainsaw operator. He bakes bread, cakes, meat pies, etc. and retails them to his customers. He supplies them mostly by himself in the market center. People also take bulk delivery from him. His only problem now is having adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are going up. He is requesting a loan to refurbish his business. With the loan, he believes he can provide for his family and most especially his children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice W. M. is thirty two years old, married to a business man and has a one year old child. Her business is located at Gikomba in Narobi where for the past year she has engaged in making and selling ladies suits. She sells her products to wholesalers and retailers and she is actually using her loan to buy rolls of cloth to make more suits to grow her business.

Her major challenge is that many people in Gikomba market engage in this kind of business and thus customers are spoilt for choice. However, she does not give up and she works very hard and even hopes that, in future, she will own property that will bring more income to her.  She is humble and self motivated. She is an enterpreneur and has created employment for other people.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Sara Ruth

texts.es: La Sr(a).  Sara G. G.. Se dedica al destace de cerdos para elaborar ricos nacatamales es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares su estado civil es acompañada en esta actividad tiene mucha experiencia de más de 18 años
texts.en:
La Señora Sara G. G. butchers pigs and makes delicious nacatamales (a traditional food of banana leaves filled corn mash stuffed with meat and steamed). She is the mother of three school-aged children and lives with her partner. She has a lot of experience in this kind of work and has been doing it for the last 18 years.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork and leaves to make nacatamales

loans.name: Cesare

texts.en: Cesare M. is from Pagadian City. She is 28 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cesare owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Cesare joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Cesare is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
B. Irina is 37 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Irina owns a successful clothing sales business at the market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 10 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. 

Irina tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. She has requested a loan of 1500 USD to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Irina will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her persevering work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of growing her business

loans.name: Rose Wanjiru

texts.en:
Rose Wanjiru N. is 55 years old and a medical practitioner married to James who is a retired doctor. They have one son and two daughters aged 20, 32, and 37 years respectively. Rose has been operating a Medical Clinic for the past 17 years. She also does farming as her other source of income.

Rose was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She is servicing her second loan with Kadet. She plans to expand her business and offer more drugs with the loan.

Her main intention is to construct a childrens clinic on her piece of land with the extra profit generated from the business. Her future hopes are to buy another piece of land and build residential houses.

Rose says that she is a strong lady, though sometimes she goes through challenging moments especially when she treats patients who either pay her little or just promise to settle the full amount later but later breach the contract. Others don’t pay anything, but she encourages herself and continues with her business.

Rose describes herself as a hardworking lady who is positive about life, loves to counsel people, attends to her patients and helps the needy in the society.

loans.use: To expand business and add more drugs.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
N. Zuhura is a hardworking business woman who is married to Gigulu Peter. They are blessed with six children who are all in school. N. Zuhura is a resident of Kayunga west. 

She has been in her business for over eleven years. She is using the loan to purchase medicine and other clinic items. Her hope is to educate children who wish to become doctors in the future.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and other clinic items.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Estela J.,  se dedica a la venta de Ropa interior y joyas de plata por la zona, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, y con mucho entusiasmo formó un comité de mujeres emprendedoras en su barrio denominado Constitución de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, el grupo esta conformado por 17 integrantes, son señoras muy trabajadoras, independientes, solidarias y con un solo interés  el de salir para delante. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir (camperas, botas, busos, pantalones) de manera a diversificar sus productos y además por llega la temporada otoño-invierno.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Estela J. makes a living selling underwear and silver jewlery in the area. She is the single mother of two children. She enthusiastically formed a committee of woman entrepreneurs in her neighborhood called Constitution of the city of Caaguazú. The group is made up of 17members who are hardworking señoras, independent, and in solidarity. They have one goal -- to get ahead. She is applying for this loan to buy articles of clothing (jackets, boots, sweatshirts, and pants) so she can diversify her products and for the fall-winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing like jackets, pants, knits, t-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem K., 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells chilli for a gross income of $25 US per day. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of $2.60 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more chilli and clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more chilli and clothes to resell

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla T. is a widow who supports her family by farming (she has a coconut plantation) and selling fish. She lives in Sitio Batang, Barangay Talaban, Himamaylan City with her 5 children, who are 24 – 37 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming and fish vending business, she is gradually providing more economic stability for her family. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000.

Priscilla is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue her farming and fish vending. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her most recent loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Priscilla aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned its respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz S. is a 39-year-old poultry breeder, married with three children. Gulnaz has four years of experience in this field and her permanent clients often come to purchase chickens and geese. Gulnaz's monthly income is about 150-200 AZN. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more poultry and increase her income. Gulnaz also works as a teacher but the poultry business is her main source of income. She is going to start livestock breeding as her husband is an experienced cattle breeder. She will use half of her loan to purchase a calf.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and one calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, cologne, lotions etc.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Manincao, Sibulan, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling fruit and vegetables and a farming business. Her husband, Asilo B., 63 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have nine children who are 15 to 38 years old. Cristita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Cristita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her increase her monthly profit to 24,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 11,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional working capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save for the security of her family. Cristita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran lives in a city called Borewala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She is 33-year-old lady who makes hand-made fans to support her family. She is very good at her art and she makes a good income from her quality work. Hand-made work always gets preference in every field. She has this talent as a gift from God. 

She started doing this work independently after her marriage to contribute financially to her family. She supplies the fans to different cities but in Multan specifically because this is the city that is renowned for hand-made items.
  
Her husband runs a cold-drink corner, where he sells different brands of cold drinks such as Coca-Cola, Pepsi and 7-Up. He also supplies those bottles to others cold-drink corners. He has more than 15 years of experience in this field. 

Sughran is the mother of a son and two daughters who couldn’t get an education due to poor financial conditions. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband financially. With the loan amount, her husband will buy bottles to fulfill larger orders on time. She prays to God that in this way, her husband’s income may increase more. 

She is in her third loan cycle and is a responsible loan user of Asasah. In the past two years of loan experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In this photo, all the ladies are holding the hand-made fans made by Sughran, the group leader.

loans.use: Purchase cold drinks to fulfill larger orders

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun K. and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Smaunh, have been married since 1989. They have four children — two sons and two daughters. The family lives across the MeK. River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Yun is a rice farmer and also sells fish caught by her husband — a fisherman and a chef. In the past, she used to be a silk weaver. She is requesting a loan of  $800 to purchase silk materials for her daughter to continue her weaving business and to buy a motor for her husband’s boat.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her daughter's weaving business and buy a motor for her husband's boat.                   motor for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng C. has been operating a farming business for years, a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is a widowed mother and has eight children: one is married and seven are single. Almost all of her children are no longer in school and they work at different occupations. 

Her children also work in the farm fields frequently alongside her when they are free from their jobs. Besides her farm work, Mrs. Thorng C. has another skill in sewing clothes. She now wants to use this knowledge to earn extra income, but she needs to have material to perform this service. As she lacks money, Mrs. Thorng C. is asking for a loan to buy essential material in order to begin this service.

loans.use: To buy material in order to begin a sewing business

loans.name: Hulda Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Hulda G. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Máximo Hernández de la comunidad El charco donde tiene 23 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda con el que compraría ladrillos y zinc
texts.en: Hulda G. is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón. She works as a primary school teacher at the Máximo Hernández school of the El Charco community. She has worked there for 23 years. This is the first loan that she has applied for from Ceprodel with the goal of improving her housing. She will buy bricks and zinc with it.

loans.use: To purchase bricks and zinc

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 48 años, es miembro del grupo “Los emprendedores”, está casado con Dominica, de 46 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que crían y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. Como todo un emprendedor, él se dedica al bordado de “gachacatas” (frazadas que utilizan las madres para cargar a su hijos en la espalda); hace ya 8 años que ofrece una variedad de tejidos con bordados artísticos, gracias a su dedicación y magnífica creatividad pudo conseguir clientes no solo en el país también en Bolivia; como conocedores del arte de Jorge, llegan a su casa para solicitarle grandes cantidades de estas frazadas. Gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, el puede dedicarse a otras actividades como la ganadería; donde comercializa carne, también siembra papa y productos diversos; a lo que cosecha y los envía a la capital. Ahora quiere abrir una tienda comercial donde pueda expander más sus tejidos, con lo que asegura podrá tener mucho éxito.  Es el quinto crédito con MFP y siente que su banco comunal le enseña a proyectarse y salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará materiales de Dralón (hilos de colores), con los que podrá tejer nuevas frazadas con diversos bordados; asimismo comprará abono natural para su cultivo de papa.
texts.en: Jorge is 48 years old and is member of the communal group, " Los emprendedores" ( The Entrepreneurs).  He is married to 46 year old Dominica and together they have 3 children whom they educate and raise in their home located in the rural area of Palcamayo.  Being a total entrepreneur, he embroiders "gachacatas" ( baby wraps that mothers use to carry their kids on their back ); for 8 years now he has been offering a variety of stitchings with artistic embroidery.  Thanks to his dedication and magnificent creativity he was able to not only attract clients in the country but also Bolivia; those familiar with Jorge's art arrive at his doorstep to place large orders of baby wraps.  Thanks to the support of his communal bank, he can dedicate himself to other activities like raising livestock for commercial use; he also grows potatoes and other diverse products that he harvests and then ships off to the capital.  He would now like to open up a store in order to further expand his emroidery which he assures it could be a success.  This is his 5th loan with MFP and he feels like his communal bank teaches him how to plan and get ahead.  With this loan he would purchase Dralon thread (colored thread) which he could use to stitch new wraps with diverse embroidering and also purchase natural fertilizer to cultivate his potatoes.

loans.use: Purchased colored thread.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie S. is 51 years old. She lives in Trento Agusan Del Sur with her husband. They have owned a rice farm for quite a long time now and have eight children.

One of her dreams is to see her farm grow and become more productive.  However, with limited access to capital, she finds that hard to do.  Julie will primarily use the loan to buy fertilizers.  She aims to expand her business.

Any additional income will go to her family's daily consumption and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 23 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y luchadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Julio de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El lugar favorito para comprar ropa en la ciudad de San Francisco (Ayacucho), es un mercado llamado “Gamarrita”, es aquí donde Maribel tiene su puesto de venta. En este lugar vende toda la ropa que trae de la ciudad de Lima, su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y bonitos, todo esto junto a su gran habilidad para persuadir a sus compradores, hacen que su negocio sea muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda más grande, en el cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre esta poniendo la cuota de humor en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en esta parte de la selva peruana.
texts.en:
Maribel is 23 years old.  She is a very happy young mother who is a real fighter.  She lives in a rented house together with her husband, 35 year-old Julio and her 2 beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.  The most popular place for buying clothes in the city of San Francisco (Ayacucho) is the Gamarrita market.  This is where Maribel has her stall.  This is where she sells all the clothes that she brings from the city of Lima.  Her business is very busy since the styles she sells are all very new and beautiful and she also has a great skill for persuading her customers.  This makes her business very profitable.

What Maribel most likes about her work is advising her customers on which clothes suit them best since it is a way to entertain herself for a while.  She has been in this business for 3 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay at her stall all day.  Over time, she would like to have a larger store in which she could provide her customers with a better service.

This is Maribel's second loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to make all her repayments punctually if she wants to take another loan in the future and she is ready to do so.  She is a very happy member of her community bank and she is always injecting a bit of humor into their meetings.  She will use the 1,500 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more clothes in Lima, preferably summer clothes since these are the ones that sell best in this part of the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise (summer clothes)

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is a 28 year-old married woman who has been living in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. She has made her living by working at the garment industry since 2008.  She has a life partner in her husband (pictured) who is a buyer and a seller palm sugar in his community. The couple help each other to earn a profit to make their life better. Chan S.’s husband's business is running well and now he wishes to add more capital to expand his business. Chan S. want to encourage him, but she lack's cash to make this possible. Chan S. will use her loan to support her husband’s business by purchasing more palm sugar to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more palm sugar to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is engaged in farming, specifically in producing corn, as her main source of income. She has been operating her business for five years and earn a monthly net income of 3,000 PHP. Letecia is 55 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga.

In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for corn production. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production.

loans.name: 42- Thon 1 - Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Tuyen N. T. (100) is a 54 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Tuyen is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 42- Thon 1- Quang Hung (18- 01- 42 Quang Hung).

Tuyen is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Tuyen owns and operates a business venture running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community.  Tuyen has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Tuyen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuyen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tuyen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Tu (111) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  T. T. Hoa (105) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3.  V. T. Nham (102) is a 54 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  N. T. Phuong (108) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

5.  T. T. Hai (109) is a 71 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

6.  C. T. Ha (101) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

7.  N. T. Hoan (103) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 52-year-old Chen S.'s daily routine. Chen S. provides her service to her neighbors: sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Chen S. is married to Kosal, 30, a government official, and they have only one child who is still living under their care. Chen S.’s husband has been paying for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Chen S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase a used motorcycle in order to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Chhoem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Damnak Reachea village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chhoem C., born in 1974,  has been selected as the group leader.  The other members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chhoem C. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sok Sorn, is a construction worker and a fisherman. Mrs. Chhoem C. wants to breed pigs, but her savings is not sufficient, so she is applying for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding to start a new business. 

She is a mother of three children. Two attend the local public school, and the third is 6 years old.

loans.use: To buy two piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Sichhoeurn Kea Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Angkor village, Takeo Province, live 12 people who make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Sichhoeurn K. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. Each member will use his or her portion of the loan to improve the family's standard of living. Mrs. Sichhoeurn K. and her husband, Mr. Thol Morm, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land, where they can grow rice to sell in order to support their family. They sell coffee, too. In the rice field, they have a problem because their field is located far from an irrigation system. In order to improve rice production, Mrs. Sichhoeurn K. is requesting a loan to buy gasoline. She has two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expand typical clothing sales stall

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en: Jonah is 44 years old and the father of four.  He does construction and carpentry. In this business, he has employed two people. He also runs a restaurant so as to supplement his family’s income. Since Jonah joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his finances. He dreams of owning a construction company in the future. He needs a  loan of 50,000 kes to expand his business premises.

loans.use: To expand his business premises

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria de 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Comenzó con la tienda desde que su cuñado era el dueño y debido a una mala administración ella la compro para tener mejores ingresos. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Vende en su tienda detergentes, bebidas, aceite, arroz. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir trabajando ya que tiene tres hijos de 24, 22 y 10 años de edad y quiere darles una buena economía. Por eso quiere el préstamo para surtir su tienda con bebidas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 49, is a hard-working woman who owns a small corner shop that she operates from her house.  Her brother-in-law used to run the business but he wasn't a good manager and Gloria took over.  

Gloria now works from 6:30am to 11:00pm seven days a week.  She sells detergents, soft drinks, cooking oil, rice, etc.  She wants to make a success of the business because she has three children--24-, 22- and 10-years old, respectively--and she wants to provide for them.  She's applying for a loan to buy soft drinks that she will resell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for corner shop

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum V. is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector for years. Her husband earns a living by driving a horse cart in and around his community. The humble couple have five children, two of whom are married. 

Sum V. grows rice on her own farmland, then harvests and sells the mature produce around three months after planting.  From this business, she generates an income of around $3 USD per day. She is taking out a loan to decorate her old house. She appears with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: to decorate her old house

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 37 years old. She has 3 children aged between 11 and 16 who are all in school. Her husband is a soldier. Esther is a tailor and she also sells onions. She has done this for 10 years. This business has enabled her to pay her children's school fees and to also feed her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions and some equipment for her tailoring business

loans.use: To buy onions and tailoring equipment

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua G. is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. She makes rice porridge for sale at Elmina. Ekua uses her income to help her husband provide the basic needs of the home.

 Ekua will use the Kiva loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and other items used in preparing porridge. Ekua plans to plough back her new expected profit into the business.

In this picture, G. is kneeling close to the rice she uses for the rice porridge. At the time of the visit, she had finished selling for the day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, etc. used in preparing porridge.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 41 years old.  He is married to Miriam and they have one child who is 4 years old.  He contributes to the family income by running a retail trading business.  He has been in this business for 2 years and earns an income of KES 7,500 per month.

Nicholas is taking out his first loan after being introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member.   He wants to use this loan to buy stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat.  His hope is to educate his child and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Ala'a

texts.en: Ala'a is a 24 year old single man from Al Ashrafieh, Jordan. Years ago, Ala'a started his spice business by peddling his products on the street.  Now Ala'a has his own shop. Ala'a is requesting a loan of 1350JD to expand his shop and purchase more products. Ala'a aspires to open a second shop.

loans.use: to expand his shop and purchase more products

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sardines, shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Marilou has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from handicrafts.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 28-year-old businesswoman who is a single mother of two children ages six and eight. For the past four years, she has been selling clothing. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES which she uses to provide for her children’s needs.

Patricia is applying for her second loan with KADET to purchase new clothing for her shop to increase the variety of merchandise she provides to her clients. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. Patricia will use the anticipated profits from her loan to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s business of driving. With the loan, he will repair his taxi car, which will allow him to provide better transport services to his passengers.  

Surriya is a widow and spends her time at home doing her household responsibilities. She is the mother of three other children. Both of her sons are drivers while her daughter is studying. 

She is very hopeful about the future development of her son’s business. He has been operating it for the past 10 years and Surriya is confident that he will be able to increase his income after repairing his transport, which will help him also save his business asset. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To repair a taxi car

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has five children, age 21 to 10 years old. She lives in her own residential house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 

For 14 years, Christine has had a bar and restaurant business, and from this business she has been able to build a commercial house. 

She faces a challenge in the high rate of inflation. 

She hopes to modify her business into a hotel. Christine intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer and food for sale.

loans.use: To buy beer and food to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and only child. He is from Lebanon. He has 15 years of experience working in the agricultural field. In 2009, Ahmad purchased land and started cultivating different types of vegetables according to the season. He has two part-timers helping him accomplish the work tasks. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He will also perform the needed maintenance on the water canal to help the products grow. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his business productivity and profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and perform maintenance on the water canal

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu is 46 years of age and married with two children. Fotu owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business. Fotu needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Fotu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fotu's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a businessman aged 37. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last three years, he has been selling caps, key holders and belts to provide for his family. He also practices dairy farming for more income generation. In the next five years, he wants to buy a piece of land for business purposes. He is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy two heifers.

loans.use: To buy two heifers

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Sunacc Huayta, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años. Luisa es mayorista de papa en el Mercado Las Américas, antes vendía salchipollos en su casa, recuerda que su primer crédito lo utilizó para comprar un carrito para vender salchipollos, ahora ella con su esposo son mayoristas de papa, agradece mucho a Finca, los préstamos que ha recibido le ayudaron a su progreso, ahora invertirá en comprar mas papa para poder enviar a la costa donde esta su esposo, y su mayor anhelo ahora es poder comprar una camioneta para ya no pagar el traslado.
texts.en: Luisa is a member of the community bank Sunacc Huayta.  She is 28 years old and has 2 children.  She has been a member of  FINCA de Peru for 3 years.  Luisa is a wholesaler of potatoes in the Las Americas market.  Before this she used to sell chicken sausages from her home.  She recalls that she used her first loan to purchase a cart for the sale of the sausages.  Currently she and her husband are potato wholesalers.  She is very thankful to FINCA.  The loans that she has received have helped her to progress.  Currently she will invest in the purchase of more potatoes to send to the coast where her husband is located.  He main wish now is to be able to buy a small truck so as not to have to pay for the shipping.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She opened a mobile shop in 2007 in order to help her husband in their family's income. Mona is a hardworking woman, and she updates her business regularly with new mobiles and technologies. Most of Mona's customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends, in addition to passers-by.

Mona is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise through buying new mobile phones, accessories, and recharge cards. Mona will also invest her loan in helping her husband do maintenance to the power generator necessary for completing his business.

This is Mona's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She will work hard to make this investment a good one, as she hopes the other one will help in expanding her shop to start dealing with new technologies.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with mobile phones, accessories, and recharge cards.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 54 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a driver. Phan has been running a shop for 25 years, making iron braces. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phan intends to take a loan to buy iron pieces and metalworking equipment. The additional materials and equipment will enable her to increase her production of iron braces. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials and equipment for her production of iron braces.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita works hard to support her family. Benita is married and sells fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Benita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.
