Benita has been in this business for 20 years.

Benita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Gricelda Yamileth

texts.es:
Griselda, vive con su esposo, él trabaja como seguridad, y ella se dedica a la elaboración de loza (ollas, comales, sartenes de barro), ellos tienen aproximadamente 6 meses de estar casados, no tienen hijos por el momento, Griselda elabora sus productos de 8:00am a 12 mediodía, durante la tarde los deja que se sequen con ayuda del sol, en el día hace como 12 comales.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de barro, nacazcol, leña, y que tenga una parte de efectivo para disponer para el pago del transporte, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener la producción y poder generar para su hogar ganancias.
La aspiración de Griselda es que a través del apoyo de los préstamos, pueda aumentar sus ventas para comenzar a ahorrar para la construcción de su propia casa.
texts.en: Griselda lives with her husband who works as a security guard. Her business is making products from clay (pots, comales and skillets). She and her husband have been married for 6 months and don't have any children yet. Griselda makes her products from 8.00am to 12 o'clock midday. In the afternoon, she leaves her products outside to dry in the sun. She makes around 12 comales a day. Griselda is requesting this loan to buy clay, nacazcol (a dye) and firewood and to have some cash available so that she can pay for transportation. This loan will enable her to keep her production going and to make profits for her household. Griselda's aspiration is to increase her sales, through the support of loans, so that she can start saving up to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy clay, nacazcol (a dye) and firewood to make clay pots and comales (special griddles for cooking tortillas)

loans.name: Faith Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Faith SHG Group in Western Kenya! Susan is the facilitator of the Faith SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Susan takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Susan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Susan was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Susan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Susan will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Faith SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Beily

texts.es:
La Sra. Beily pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, su edad es 27 años y tiene un hijo de 1 año y 3 meses.
Cansada de estar entre cuatro paredes en su trabajo, decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio para generar ingresos desde casa y con la ayuda del Banquito y un capital de S/.300.00 compró gaseosas, frugos y posteriormente obtiene productos de su chacra como plátanos de diferentes variedades que es de consumo masivo en nuestra ciudad, que también lo esta aprovechando para generar ingresos y continuar contribuyendo con los gastos de su hogar y con la crianza de su pequeño hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una institución pública es por ello que ella se encarga de su negocio sóla.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará gaseosas y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción de plátanos y además esta realizando algunos arreglos en el pequeño espacio que le cedió su mamá para que pueda realizar la venta de sus productos.
Beily es una mujer trabajadora y  entusiasta,  su sueño es tener un Mini Market como negocio para generar mayores ingresos y poner en práctica la carrera técnica que estudió Contabilidad, y de esta manera dar trabajo a mujeres que necesitan independizarse, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por los talleres de capacitación que viene recibiendo, porque fortalece sus capacidades para seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Beily belongs to the communal bank “Pachacutec II,” district of La Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She is 27, married, and has a son who is one year and three months. 

Tired of being between four walls at work, she decided to begin a small business to generate an income from home. With the help of the communal bank and a loan of S/.300.00 she bought sodas and fruits. Later she got products from her ranch like different varieties of plantains that are widely eaten in her city. She’s making the most of being able to earn an income, to continue contributing to the household expenses, and to raise her young daughter. Her husband works in a public institution, and for that reason the business is solely in her care. 

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 she will buy soda and fertilizers to improve her plantain crop. She is also making some adjustment to the small space which was given to her by her mother so that she can sell her products. 

Beily is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. Her dream is to have a mini market business to generate a better income and to put into practice her accounting education. In this manner she will give work to women who need to be able to support themselves. She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the training workshops that she has been receiving because they enhance her ability to continue moving forwards and to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy sodas

loans.name: Hosep

texts.en: Hosep is a 48-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and two school-aged children. Because he is the main breadwinner in his family, he decided to open his own jewelery shop in 1981. He does high-quality work and has many loyal customers. He is applying for a loan for $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more of the jewels he uses in his business. His goal is to expand his business and improve his productivity. In the future, he plans to make and sell his own jewelry designs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a jewelery shop.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es: Ruth con su credikiva compró accesorios, ropa exterior e interior y hasta prendas de plata, con la que le fue muy bien; en la actualidad se prepara para hacerle otra inversión de capital de trabajo a su negocio y por eso está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento por Kiva, con él comprará mercancía en genera, sobre pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes como ropa infantil, prendas de plata y medicina natural. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: ¡Agradezco el credikiva, me siento muy bien, voy para adelante y el próximo año voy a crecer mucho mas. Me siento muy contenta con todo.”
texts.en: Ruth used her last Kiva loan to buy accessories, outerwear and underwear, and jewelry, with which she did very well. She is currently preparing to make another capital investment in her business and so she is applying for new financing from Kiva which she will use to buy merchandise in response to orders her customers have placed for children's clothes, jewelry, and natural medicines. Her message to her funders at Kiva is the following: "I appreciate the funding, I feel great, I am moving forward and I'm going to grow much more next year. I feel very happy with everything."

loans.use: to buy merchandise in general, regarding orders that customers have made for children's clothes, jewelry, and herbal medicine.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso,  tiene 38 años de edad,  es soltera y es madre de 2 hijos, a los cuales ella cría sola, con la ayuda de su familia.
La Sra. Angela tiene una despensa bien surtida, el que está instalado en su local propio,  en su casa. Nos comenta que su despensa es fruto de todo el sacrificio que ella ha hechos, ya que se inicio con un Copetín, y después cambio de rubro, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya formada. Ella cuenta que todo el sacrificio que ella hace es por sus hijos, para darles lo mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, yerba, carne, panificados, artículos de limpieza y otros, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y seguir surtiendo a sus clientes. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que les da la fundación y kiva
texts.en:
Angela is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She is 38 years old, single and the mother of 2 children. She is raising them alone, with the help of her family.  

Angela has a well stocked store in her own locale at her home. She tell us that her store is the result of all the sacrifices she has made. She started out selling snacks, and then changed her area of work. Now it is going well for her with regular customers. She says that all of the sacrifices she has made are for her children, in order to give them the best.

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, herbs, meat, baked goods, cleaning supplies and more in order to stock her store and keep supplying her customers. She is very grateful for the opportunity that the foundation and Kiva are giving her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, herbs, meat, baked goods, cleaning supplies and more.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: El señor Braulio es contador y además percibe ingresos de su taxi. El crédito que requiere es para la refacción  de una habitación de una habitación en su casa, pues necesita terminar la obra fina y pintado de la misma. Braulio  es casado  y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  Central  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con kiva.
texts.en:
Braulio is an accountant.  He also gets income from his taxi.

He needs the loan to repair a room in his house.  He needs to finish the work and paint the room.

Baulio is married and has four children.  He lives in his own house in the central zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to a room in his house.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José Santos tiene 57 años de edad, el negocio al que se dedica  es un taller de radio técnico. El negocio consiste en un taller donde se dan mantenimiento y reparaciones a televisores, equipos de sonido, DVD entre otros, así como también venta de repuestos facilitándole y asegurándole al cliente la reparación del artefacto. Este negocio José lo aprendió desde muy joven ya que sus padres no tuvieron lo suficiente dinero para pagarles sus estudios y tuvo que trabajar para apoyarlos en los gastos del hogar. José Santos está solicitando financiamiento para capital trabajo.
texts.en: José Santos is 57 years old.  The business he’s in is an electronics repair shop.  It consists of a workshop where he repairs and services television sets, sound equipment and DVD players, among others as well as the sale of spare parts easing and insuring repair of the customer’s appliance.  José learned this business while still young because his parents did not have enough money to pay for his schooling and he had to go to work to help them with household expenses.  José Santos is asking for financing to use as working capital.

loans.use: to use as working capital.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 45 old year married woman, who has 4 family members. From Al Zarqa, Amman Jordan.She requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for food materials to sell ( Traditional food : Dawali, Mahashi.....)
She would like open a shop. In the future she wants to increase her income also economic and financial development .

loans.use: to pay for food materials to sell

loans.name: Rezq Allah

texts.en:
Rezq allah is a 27 year old married man who has 4 family members from Baqa'a Jordan.He is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for materials for making cleaning products to sell.In the future he hopes to open a factory and he would like to increase his social economic status.
Since Rezq Allah is under 30 year old,his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson, de 31 años, está casado con Rubí de 30 años y tienen 04 hijos de 12,  05, 04 años y 07 meses de nacido, vive en casa de sus padres en donde habilitaron un espacio y pudo construir una pequeña vivienda. Gerson se dedica a la carpintería, es un hombre prodigioso con sus manos, pues puede convertir cualquier pedazo de madera en una obra de arte y también construye casas muy hermosas y elegantes. Poco a poco aprendió a desarrollar su trabajo gracias a las enseñanzas de un gran maestro de obras quien siempre lo orientó para no cometer errores. Trabaja en esta actividad por más de 04 años y lo realiza siempre con mucho esmero y dedicación porque sabe que con eso sustenta a su familia. está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales y herramientas para seguir haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en: Gerson, 31 years old, is married to Rubi, who is 30 years old.  They have four children - a 12 year old, 5 year old, 4 year old, and a newborn of 7 months.  He lives in his parents' house where they were able to build out a small space and could construct a living area.  Gerson works in carpentry and is a prodigious man with his hands.  He can turn any piece of wood into a work of art, and he also builds very beautiful and elegant homes.  Little by little, he learned to develop his work thanks to the teachings of a great mentor who always taught him how to avoid mistakes.  He works in this activity for more than four years and he does it always with a lot of care and dedication because he knows that this is what helps to sustain his family. He is very happy for the financial support that they are offering him because with this, he feels confident in improving his line of work.  He is devoted to paying his installments in a punctual manner.  With the amount requested, he will buy materials and tools in order to continuing doing his work.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for carpentry.

loans.name: Wanignon-Pouce 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 3 est composé de huit personnes qui sont dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Abikè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Abikè est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Abikè est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Bolinoumin. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Abikè vend à son domicile depuis cinq ans du vin de palme. Parallèlement à cette activité, Abikè vend du sucre ; ce qui lui  permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses enfants. Abikè s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Abikè ensemble avec les membres du  groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 3, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du vin de palme et du sucre.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa owns a small restaurant where she sells typical Ecuadorian foods. The restaurant is located at the front of her home and is open from lunch time until about 7pm. She has been in the restaurant business for her whole life because her mother also ran a similar operation when she was young. Narcisa started this business shortly after she married when she realized that the income her husband was brining in would not be enough for her and their two children.

She needs this loan in order to make structural improvements to the restaurant and to also buy tables and chairs. Her goal is to grow her operation and add new items to the menu in order to attract new clients.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her restaurant and buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Laté

texts.en:
Born in Aného in 1975, Mr. L. Laté is married and the father of two (02) children. With his secondary education level he has been developing his business for ten years in Afagnan where he resides. The sale of kerosene remains his principal activity. Today Mr. L. Laté holds an enormous experience in the kerosene business. His first loan, which was repaid on time, allowed him to start up his activity in a place where there was no point of sale.

Facing a strong demand, he is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a kerosene storage tank and will retail the kerosene in small units. From this business Mr. L. Laté will be able to make a better income and will improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Aného en 1975, Monsieur L. Laté est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Avec son niveau d'instruction secondaire, il développe ses affaires depuis une dizaine d’années à Afagnan où il réside. La vente du pétrole reste son activité principale. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur L. Laté possède une énorme expérience dans la vente du pétrole. Son premier crédit qui a été bien soldé, lui a permis de démarrer son activité dans un milieu où il n’y a aucune station de vente.

Face à la forte demande, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter une citerne de pétrole et la revendre par unité. De ce commerce, Monsieur L. Laté pourra mieux dégager de revenus et améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a storage tank for kerosene

Achat d'une citerne de pétrole

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a widow and the mother of eight. She has been working hard since she was very young, dedicating her life to supporting her children. She started cooking snacks and selling them on the street and through the years her business grew and she set up a small area in her home where she serves her home cooking. With the help of her children she now caters banquets and prepares tamales that others sell on the weekends. Celia is asking for a loan of $275 to buy ingredients and meet the growing demand for her cooking. She proposes to repay the loan in 4-8 months and thanks you in advance for helping her give her 8 children a good education and better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Celia es una mujer viuda que se ha dedicado a trabajar desde muy joven, tiene 8 hijos por los cuales ha dedicado toda su vida para sacarlos adelante, ella empezó con su negocio vendiendo comidas y gorditas (comida típica) en la calle en un puesto semi fijo, pero con el paso de los años fue creciendo con su negocio y en su propia casa abrió un pequeño local para la venta de sus comidas, algunos de sus hijos la ayudan en su local y han crecido, ya que ahora ella ofrece sus comidas a terceros al por mayor para su venta y también ofrece el servicio de banquetes y tamales los fines de semana.

Celia esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar suministros y así cumplir con la demanda creciente que esta teniendo, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 4 a 8 meses y espera de tu apoyo para continuar creciendo y así poder darles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida a sus 8 hijos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Yleana Lucelly

texts.es:
For the past 10 years, Yleana has been selling clothing. She began her business because she needed extra income to cover the cost of sending her daughters to school. Her daughters are 11 and 19 years old respectively. She began by selling used clothing to her neighbors, but at her customers' request she began seeing new clothing as well. This caused her sales to increase considerably. Now she has managed to acquire a stand in the market, where she has further increased her number of clients.

In order to provide better service and to improve the image her business gives, Yleana is requesting a loan of $475. She will use this to buy a display case and dummies, with which she hopes to increase her sales. She offers to repay her loan in 6 months. Please help this business grow. Yleana would be very grateful for the support and the opportunity it would give her business to expand.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años, Yleana se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para cubrir los costos de la escuela de sus hijas, ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 19 años de edad. Inició vendiendo bisutería y ropa usada entre sus vecinas, pero a petición de sus clientes incorporó la venta de ropa nueva y sus ventas se mejoraron considerablemente, ahora ha logrado adquirir un puesto en el mercado, donde ha logrado ampliar su número de clientes.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y darle una mejor imagen a su negocio, Yleana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de un aparador y exhibidores, con los que espera incrementen sus ventas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Yleana agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de crecer como microempresaria.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is a hard working mother of seven who has suffered from a broken home due to a divorce with her husband. With seven children to take care of, she became a member of GHAPE.  Before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then, she has been able to invest and repay all her loans with which she raised money to buy good food for her household, pay school fees, buy medications, and increase her business.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to do gardening and rear pigs so she can sell them. Given the fact that pigs take long to fatten, she plans to cultivate and sell vegetables so she can have short term turn over and start repaying her loan. The money raised will be used to build a house for her family and to pay the children’s school fees. 
She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. Her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs, pig feed, seeds, capital for her son

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue and her husband have planted 200 pillards of green dragon, but the plants are still too young to realize a profit from them. Hue, her husband, and one of children support  the family by work as day laborers.Their other children are in the 12th, 5th and 2nd class.Their average income is $13 per month/person. Hue is requesting a loan of $75 to invest to their green dragon planting and will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru:
Shavkat N. has been in business for over 4 years. He is married and has 4 children. The profits from his business go to family expenditures. Shavkat will use his loan to expand his product assortment of winter goods.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нарзуллоев Шавкат Хабибуллоевич более 4 лет занимается бизнесом. Женат, имеет 4 несовершеннолетних детей. Весь доход получаемый от бизнеса идет на покрытие семейных затрат. Шавкат хочет расширить свой ассортимент зимним товаром и увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: Increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
When her spouse retired, Luz saw the need to leave her home and start selling plants, natural medicines and flowerpots in the street.

After 7 years and much effort, she has a small stand in the Virgen de Fátima market where she sells her products.

With the income her business has generated, Luz has been able to help her husband support their 5 children.

Although she has only been in this location for a year, she wishes to expand it and sell other products like lotions and popsicles during the hot season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Al jubilarse su esposo, Luz se vio en la necesidad de dejar su hogar y comenzar a vender en la calle plantas, medicinas naturales y macetas.

Luego de 7 años y con mucho esfuerzo, ha puesto un pequeño puesto en el mercado Virgen de Fátima donde vende sus productos.

Con los ingresos que su negocio le ha generado, Luz ha podido ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.

Aunque recién tiene un año en este establecimiento, desea ampliarlo y vender otros productos como emolientes y chupetes en las épocas de calor.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Kakooza G(Ii) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Deborah N..  She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000  to expand the business.  Deborah is 32 years old and is single.  She has 2 children, ages 10 and 8, and her children go to school.  Each week, Deborah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Deborah is joined in her small group by Mustafah Mbizza, Edith Nakyobe, Annet N., and Cissy N..  Mustafah Mbizza is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to to invest in her stone business.  Edith Nakyobe is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to expand her business.  Annet N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000  to hire more help for quarrying stones. Cissy N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 400000 to  re-invest in the business.

loans.use: To expand the stone quarrying business

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance D. is a trader who sells clothes and slippers.  She is 25 years old and single.  She sells her products in the central market in Cape Coast.  Constance is requesting a loan of $525 to buy additional clothing and slippers.

Constance is also a member of a lending group called “Faith Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing and slippers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan L. is married with six children. She has been with GHAPE for six years and was motivated to join the program by other members after being mistreated by her husband. With her meager income, she faced the burden of taking care of her children. With a loan from GHAPE, she was able to provide the family with basic needs.

Given a new loan, she plans to invest in motorbike transport, which is of high demand in her locality and pig farming. She believes the business will be lucrative because the people in the locality are highly in need of public transport (Motor bike taxi) due to the poor condition of roads. Also, she will pay for the documents of the bike like insurance and helmets. With the training she received from GHAPE on raring pigs she wishes to expand her pig farm by buying more piglets, feed and repair the existing fence. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike and piglets

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Mr. Kea C. lives in Sre Au Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is 25 and is a farmer as well as a pig breeder. He is married with one child who is too young to work or study. His wife, Sreynich Tun, is a palm sugar maker in the local village. They both are hard workers and try to earn money to support their living expenses and the ones of their families.

To improve their living conditions, they want to start a new business. Consequently Mr. Kea C. would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle with a cart to transport coal to Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where he can sell the coal for a higher price. ( His wife is also in the picture with him).

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle with a cart to transport coal.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en: This is Nazirjon M., who is married with five children. He is 48 years old and lives in Isfara town, Tajikistan. He has a retail shop and he is the one to support his family with this business. Nazirjon sells spare parts for foreign cars like Mercedes-Benz and Opel. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. He provides the cars with spare parts and his family with the necessary food and needs. Nazirjon has a great demand for his spare parts thus he wants to buy more spare parts in order to be in requisition of his clients. He hopes to increase his income and be able to send his two elder sons to the University. He wants to take out an individual loan for $900 US Dollars to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income for his family. The loan will be repaid within 8 months. Nazirjon is happy about this loan and would like to thank everyone for your trust and promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: Nazirjon would like to purchase spare parts for cars to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina has always been very dedicated to improving the economic situation of her family. In the community where she lives she works in the fabrication of bricks, an activity she grew up knowing about. She has already been working in her factory for 9 years and plans to continue working for many more years which is why she is applying for a loan of 2000 soles to increase her working capital. Through this she will improve the well being of her family and cover the educational expenses of her 3 children. Help Catalina to continue working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Catalina siempre ha estado muy decidida a mejorar la situación económica de su familia. En la comunidad donde ella vive se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos, y ella creció conociendo esta labor. Es así, que ya lleva 9 años de intenso trabajo en su fábrica y con la mentalidad de seguir trabajando por muchos años más, por ello solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para incrementar el capital de trabajo de su fábrica y de este modo ir mejorando el bienestar de su familia y cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus 3 hijos. Apoya a Doña Catalina a seguir esforzándose.

loans.use: Increase the capital of her brick factory.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda began her business to help her partner economically with the costs of the family. Her children are small and they do not have enough money for the most basic expenses. She began her salon several years ago. At first she just did haircuts and styling but little by little it has grown and her clientele has increased.

She needs a loan of $675 for work supplies that she will repay in 6 months. With your help, she will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Hila inició el negocio para apoyar economicamente a su pareja con los gastos de la familia.ya que sus hijos estaban pequeños y no completaban con el dinero para los gastos mas necesarios. Comenzó con su estetica hace varios años, primero hacia solo cortes y peinados pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ha logrado incrementar su clientela.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo. con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy work material

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.en:
The San Juan group is maD. up of twelve women and two men, most of whom work in different business sectors. Silvia and Felicia work as domestic help; Jose is a mechanic; Esperanza, Norah, Laida, Angelica and Marisabel sell food (chicken, prepared meals and gelatin desserts); Jesus is a carpenter; Melvi sells cosmetics; Aquilina sells veterinary supplies; and Nelda, Karen and Claudia all sell clothing. All of them have 8 years or less of experience working in their respective businesses, and they all plan to use their Kiva loans to purchase more materials or merchandise to sell.

Many of the women have worked with other microfinance institutions before. This is the second loan San Juan has taken out with AgroCapital.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell, such as cosmetics, veterinary supplies, clothing, and food

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juany inició el negocio porque lo que gana su esposo no le alcanza ya que trabaja como soldador y tiene ingresos variables, ante la necesidad de pagar recibos de servicios y manutención de sus hijos. Comenzó hace más de 3 años vendiendo productos naturales entre vecinos y familiares, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía en general. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Juany started the business because what her her husband makes wasn't enough, since her husband works as a soldier and has variabl wages, to meet the need to pay their bills and raise their children. She started selling natural groceries to her neighbors and families 3 years ago, which has permitted her to move forward. She needs a $250 loan which she will pay in three months to buy general merchandise. With your support, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Izcuchaca Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Señor D. Los Milagros D. Izcuchaca esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Izcuchaca en Huancavelica, es una zona turística, donD. los pobladores son quechua hablantes. Entre las actividades principales que realiza la comunidad esta la venta D. bollo (pancitos D. queso y calabaza), empanadas, chicharrones, se destaca la ganadería, agricultura y apicultura.

Daría E., es viuda, tiene 64 años y 4 hijos ya mayores, se dedica desD. hace 30 años a la venta D. chicharrones, desD. muy temprano sube a los microbuses a vender. Siempre invierte en su negocio pues es su único medio D. vida. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean felices que no sufran, que Dios les guíe el camino para que sean hombres D. bien.

Maximiliana A., tiene 4 hijos, , se dedica a la venta D. agua D. manzana y gaseosa en los carros, sus prestamos los invierte en su negocio en la compra D. baldes para la venta D. agua D. manzana y la compra D. gaseosas al por mayor. Su sueño es tener una tienda granD. y vender D. todo, así obtener mayores ingresos para el estudio D. sus hijos.

Yolanda R., es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta D. tara, ovejas y animales menores, este negocio lo realiza hace mas D. 5 años. Tuvo que afrontar con su familia el abandono D. su pareja, pero salió adelante, sus préstamos los invierte en la compra D. mas animales. Su sueño es llevar sus productos a otros departamentos y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
The communal bank "Señor D. Los Milagros D. Izcuchaca" is located in the Izcuchaca community in Huancavelica. This is a tourist area where the population are quchua speakers. Among the principal businesses in this community are the sale of "bollo" (bread with cheese and squash), empanadas and pork rinds. Livestock farming, agriculture and apiculture are also practiced in the community.

Daria E. is a widow. She is 64 years old and has four older children. For 30 years she has dedicated herself to selling pork rinds. She gets on the buses in the early hours of the day to sell. She always invests in her business as this is her only means to survive. Her dream is that her children will be happy and not suffer and that God guiD. their path so that they will be men of good.

Maximiliana Atacusi has four children. She dedicates herself to the sale of apple juice and soft drinks. She invests the loans she receives in her business by buying containers for the sale of apple juice and in buying soft drinks wholesale. Her dream is to have a large store and be able to sell all kinds of things so that she can obtain a better income that will allow her to proviD. for her children's education.

Yolanda R. is a single mother. She has three children and dedicates herself to the sale of "tara", sheep and small animals. She has been in this business for more than five years. She had to face off with her family because she left her partners but she was able to get ahead. She invests her loans in the purchase of more animals. Her dream is to be able to take her products to other areas and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business such as food production, agriculture, apiculture and soft drink sales.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Рахимов Нурали житель города Яван. Женат и имеет семерых детей. 14 лет занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует тканями на центральном рынке города. Для того, чтобы ввезти сезонный товар хочет получить кредит , сроком на 18 месяцев.Кредит поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Nurali R. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has seven children. For 14 years he has been working in sales. He sells fabric at the city's central market. He would like to receive a loan for import of seasonal goods. The loan term will be 18 months. The loan will help him increase sales and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Import seasonal goods

loans.name: Irene Abigail

texts.es:
La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Irene Candia es a la costurería la cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur y se ha destacado por elaborar excelentes trajes de vestir para niños, damas, caballeros de todo tipo y de diferentes tamaños.

Desde que comenzó con su negocio ha logrado mejorarlo y para esto lo ha hecho por medio de los créditos que solo Ceprodel brinda. Es importante destacar que gracias a este apoyo brindado ha logrado comprar su máquina, y materiales de trabajo. Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de materiales de trabajo como tela, hilo y agujas para continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
Irene Candia's business activity is sewing, which she performs in her house in the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur, and has stood out by making excellent suits for children, women and men of all types and sizes. Since starting her business she has managed to improve it through loans that only Ceprodel provides. It's important to note that thanks to this support she has managed to purchase her sewing machine and work materials. Today the reason for her loan request is for the purchase of work materials, such as fabric, thread and needles to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials

loans.name: Ashura E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Ashura M. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children between ages 6 and 7. Ashura has been running a clothes business since 1998. She sells clothes retail, including vitenge and khanga (Tanzanian traditional clothes).

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Ashura currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Ashura thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a married mom with two children. She lives in Ordzhonikidze and owns a small business selling souvenirs in the central city mall. Natalya has many loyal customers who know her little store for its versatile merchandise and affordable prices. She has been in the business for 8 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about 25,000 Grivnas. Monthly profit is about 2,600 Grivnas.

Natalya would like to increase assorted inventory in her store and her sales as a result. She is hoping to get a stable source of income and continue developing her business. A committed wife and mother, Natalya works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. Today she is requesting a loan of 3,500 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Many

texts.en:
Mrs. Many U. and her husband, Mr. Khat Sokhorn, residents of Ta Smorn village in Takeo province, are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they cultivate both rice and vegetables. Because the field is far from irrigation, their crops are adversely affected; in order to solve this problem, Many is requesting a loan to buy a water pump and pump supplies to use on the field. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan.

Many is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and other pump supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Rutilde Maria

texts.es:
Rutilde es socia del Bancomunal Señor de los Milagros.
Rutilde es casada tiene 41 años, cinco hijos de 25,22, 20, 12, 10, los dos menores están en la escuela estatal.
Rutilde trabaja en una empresa de tejido ella hace acabados durante el día, en su casa  tiene su negocio de venta de cerveza y gaseosa en a ella vende a puerta cerrada. Quiere decir que  los vecinos le tocan la puerta para comprarles, cuando ella se va a trabajar, sus hijos son los que despachan la cerveza y gaseosa.  
Rutilde ha presentado problemas en su salud el año pasado la operaron de los riñones, tuvieron que quitarle uno, quedándose en reposo por tres meses. 
Desde que está en Finca aprendió como administra su negocio, a ahorrar, también aprende de las charlas entre las socias que comparten experiencias de negocio.
Rutilde necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar cajas de cerveza.  
El sueño de Rutilde es abrir un negocio de bazar.
texts.en:
Rutilde is a member of the Communal Bank of Señor de los Milagros. She is 41 years old and married, and has five children ages 25, 22, 20, 12, and 10. The two youngest go to public school.

Rutilde works in a knitting business, where she makes finished products during the day. In her house, she has a business selling beer and soft drinks. Her neighbors come to knock on her door when they want to buy drinks, and when she is at work, her children sell the beer and soft drinks.

Rutilde has had health problems in the past year, and she had to have kidney surgery in which one of her kidneys was removed, so she was in bed for three months.

Since Rutilde has been with Finca, she has learned to run her business, to save, and she also learns from her the conversations she has with her fellow borrowers who share their business experiences.

Rutilde needs a loan of 1200 soles (about $400 US) to buy beer to sell. Her dream is to open up a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer for resale

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.en:
Bakhtiniso S. is 22 years old, married and has one child. She works with her husband purchasing and reselling cows. She is requesting a loan of US$600 in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes that this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. You could become an important part in Bakhtiniso's family's life, and she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle for business expansion.

loans.name: Bikenja

texts.ru: Бикенча женщина 44 лет, замужем имеет троих,кредитуется уже пятый год.Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию,каждый месяц посылает деньги на жизнь.Но Бикенча со своими сыновьями тратит деньги заработанные мужем на стройку дома.Поэтому её очень помогает на семейные расходы доход с её бизнеса, продажи в розницу носков и нижнего белья.Она благодарна всем инвесторам за поддержку и понимание, за возможность поддерживать товарооборот в кредит.
texts.en:
Bikenja is a 44 year old woman; she is married and has three children. This is her fifth year as a borrower. Her husband went to Russia to earn money and every month he sends money to live on. But Bikenja with her sons spends the money earned by her husband to build a house. Because of this her business, selling socks and underwear at retail, helps her a lot with family expenses. She is grateful to all the investors for their support and understanding, for the opportunity to maintain turnover with credit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of socks and underwear

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos M. is a married man who has run a poultry business for the last seven years. He keeps both broilers (roosters for meat) and layers (hens for eggs). He also has a dairy cow and runs a vegetable and fruit garden. His plans for his business involve constructing more poultry cages so he can raise more chicks. He supports his family through the income from this business. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Tanzanian Shillings to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more poultry chicks

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
YOLANDA G. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. La Paz N 135, tiene 46 años y 03 hijas.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el mismo que invirtió en la compra de gaseosas. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la  comprara de variedad de gaseosas y bebidas para este calor tan fuerte, y así podrá  aumentar sus ventas.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, el tiempo que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio y ayudar en la educación de sus hijos,  es una ayuda para las mujeres de nuestra región remarco.
texts.en:
YOLANDA G. R., belongs to "LAS DIVINAS” communal bank, lives at Jr. La Paz N 135, she is 46 years old, and has 03 daughters. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she invested in purchasing soft drinks. With this loan of S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy a variety of sodas and drinks for this intensely hot weather; in this way she will up her sales. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, the time she has been working has allowed her to develop her business and help help educate her daughters. Manuela Ramos is a help to the women in our region.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various sodas and drinks

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia U. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 37 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Karla es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Karla inicio este negocio ofreciendo los servicios de venta de recargas telefónicas, para celulares al ver que su demanda mejoraba, decidió invertir en bisutería y con el apoyo de su esposo han logrado salir adelante con su negocio, ya que el la ayuda a trasladarse en bicicleta a la vivienda de cada uno de sus clientes y juntos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos y gaseosas. El sueño de Karla es ampliar su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un futuro para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia U. Gutiérrez is 37 years old, and has 2 children under her care. Karla runs a neighborhood store. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 4 years. Karla started this business by offering services in the sale of pre paid phone cards for cellular phones, and once she noticed that her demand improved, she decided to invest in costume jewelry. With the support of her husband they have been able to move forward with this business, given that he would help her get to the homes of each of her clients on his bike; they did this together. The loan that she is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase basic grains, sweets, natural drinks, juices, and soft drinks. Karla’s dream is to expand her business so that her children have a future.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase basic grains, sweets, natural drinks, juices, and soft drinks).

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito P. is a responsible father who lives in a rural community, located at Barangay Darubba Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, with his family. He and his wife were blessed with three children. As a father, Charlito is doing his best to earn income and be able to support the needs of his family. His children are all studying and he wants all of them to earn a college degree.  He works very hard and patiently in farming activities so that they will have a good harvest.  

He plants vegetables and fruit trees. His wife sells the harvested fruit and vegetables in their village. Aside from farming, Charlito is also maintaining a rice mill at their place. Lack of capital encouraged him to request a loan of PHP 5,000. He said that this amount will be of great help in assisting his farming needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor K., 43, has been involved in the agriculture sector as a rice farmer and growing other crops with a typical income of US $0.50 per day in Takeo Province since 1980. K. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. Her husband and K. are blessed with two children; one of them is enrolled in a local high school while the other one is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is a blacksmith in the town with a typical income of US $6 per day.

K. really wants to take a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike to operate another business of transporting potatoes she grows to sell at the local markets. By doing this, she hopes that she will be able to generate a better income to cover her family expenses as well as for savings to support her child’s future education.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Kurbonbi

texts.ru: Гулова Курбонби проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает строителем на стройке. Сама Курбонби более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
55-year-old Encarnacion E. is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur, and has 4 children. She started farming in 2007. From this activity, her family’s daily needs were met. In need of additional capital for her farm, Encarnacion joined CEVI and is now on her first cycle.

She applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP, to be used to purchase farming necessities. Her loan will help sustain her farm, which is a major source of income for her family.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia A., 55 and the married mother of six adult-aged children, is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Anatalia owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store that sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2007, Anatalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 30,000 PHP to expand her product line. Anatalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs,

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product line

loans.name: Ephraim's Group

texts.en:
Ephraim Tabard is married with six children, all enrolled in secondary school, and is the leader of his group in Ntungamo. Ephraim has thus far received 27 loans for his hotel/restaurant in the town center of Ntungamo and has been operating for 9 years.

Recent high prices for food supplies has hurt Ephraim’s margins and he would like to use the loan amount of 200,000 USH to boost his business back up to the high levels of profitability he has previously enjoyed. His dream is to one day have a big hotel and be able to pay for his children’s university education.

loans.use: general improvements and supplies

loans.name: Itejere

texts.en:
Ovwigho is 60 years old and married with two children. She sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. The demand for cooking oil in her community is high because cooking oil is important in the preparation of local soup.

This is the high season for sales and Ovwigho hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: María Hermelinda

texts.es: Doña María T. tiene 44 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Consumo Diario”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella se dedica en la venta ,  llevan  4  años de vender,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xolcaja  del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María T., 44, is a married merchant. “Venta de Consumo Diario” (Sales of Everyday Consumables). She lives with her husband and she is in sales. They have been in sales for 4 years. They live in Paraje Zolcaja, Poxlajuj territory, department and municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, demand from her customers has increased but her financial situation does not allow her to increase her working capital to meet demand. For this reason, she called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing to buy raw materials in order to increase sales, hoping thereby to see her family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
El Señor Luis Eduardo C. Téllez, labora como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar,  es soltero , ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante dos años, en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 2 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es una persona Trabajadora y es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo C. Téllez is a cleaning and maintenance employee at the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He is a single father of two school-age children. He has had two previous loans with Ceprodel with which he managed to improve his home. He is a hard-working person and an excellent client. The financing requested is to buy building materials to reroof his home so that his children will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials to reroof his house.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is popularly called Mama Esosa in her community in Benin City, Edo state. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to improve her business and lift herself out of poverty. Her husband is a farmer. Juliet is a mother of five children and she is 48 years old.  She has been in this business for a long time. 

LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Juliet is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Zulma Yaneth

texts.es: Zulma Yaneth Z. D. P. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad y vive junto a su esposo y un hijo en casa propia, la cual con mucho esfuerzo están logrando pagar junto a su compañero D. vida. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Negocio el cual ella desea poder verlo surtido, lo cual ha sido imposible para ella, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar muchos más productos como papel higiénico, pasta dental, embutidos y otros productos más, los cuales las personas consumen más. Esto lo hace con el fin D. aumentar sus ventas, D. manera que pueda seguir adelante con su negocio y seguir ayudándole a su esposo a pagar la casa y pagar todas las cosas que como familia necesitan para vivir.
texts.en:
Zulma Yaneth Z. D. P. is 32 years old. She lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and son in their own home, which she strives to pay for together with her life partner. She has a small shop, which sells perishable items and general goods for the home. She would like to see the store stocked, which has been impossible for her. For this reason, she has requested a loan so that she can buy many more products such as toilet paper, toothpaste, cold meat, and more products that people use frequently. She hopes to increase her sales in this way so that she can get ahead with her business and continue helping her husband pay for the house and all the things that the family needs to live.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishables

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A. is thirty-six years old, married and has four children between the ages of fifteen and four years old. Her husband is a driver. They hope to give their children a good education. 

Fatuma's business is located at Mariakani, a busy residential area in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal city of Kenya and it's known for its tourist attractions because of its rich history and game parks, as well as the Indian ocean. She engages in selling chicken meat to the local people and restaurants, something she has enjoyed doing for the last two years. 

She is using her loan to buy more chickens to expand her business and meet her customers' needs despite the stiff competition and seasonal oversupply. She hopes to own rental houses in the future and improve her standard of living. She is a very sociable and customer-friendly person.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Ngang Julie

texts.en:
Julie was born on 08/07/1966. She is married to Angoudu Emmanuel and is blessed with three children under 15. Julie is a hardworking lady who has faced many challenges in life, such as ill health and being unable to care for her children. All these challenges led her to decide to become a GHAPE member in 2008. In this same year, she received her first loan of 40,000 XAF, which she repaid promptly.
With this loan of 200,0000 XAF, Julie plans to buy seven tines of corn, five tines of beans, four tines of garri, and five buckets of coco yams. The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. Julie is sure that her business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, has a good business location, and a lot of customers. Her neighbors are happy to buy from her because the distance they have to travel to market is reduced, and they can buy from her late at night. She plans to use her profits to invest back into the business, look after her son, and give good medical attention to herself and her children. She prefers loans from Kiva partner, GHAPE, because of the social services GHAPE offer and the convenient method of repayment.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, garri and coco yams for resale

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia U. is currently in the business of selling bread at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and sugar to sell. Cicilia is 20 years old and is married to a driver. She has one child who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and sugar to sell

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed A. is a 34-year-old boda boda (motorcycle taxi) driver from the town of Thika, in Kenya. Obed received a loan of KES 30,000 to expand his boda boda business. He faces challenges such as stiff competition from other motorcycle taxi operators. Obed is married and has two daughters, aged nine and six. He eventually wants to own many motorbikes to use in his taxi business and he envisions that he can be a market leader in five years. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander A. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old. Alexander is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alexander operates a business venture in motor transport services. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business. In 2004, Alexander joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alexander has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alexander is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for registration, franchise fees and licenses. This will be the twelfth loan taken out by Alexander from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise fees and licenses

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria A. is a 65-year-old married woman who supports her family by manufacturing hollow blocks. She lives in Brgy Cabagahan, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her 71-year-old husband, Grisologo, who owns and raises livestock. They have six children who are all adults.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her manufacturing of hollow blocks business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.

Gregoria is now borrowing 15,000 PHP, so that she can use the money to purchase additional working capital for her business. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gregoria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than US$1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purhcase additional working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. She lives in Kongowea in Mombasa and operates a business making juice from fruits. She has been producing and selling juice in Kongowea for one year. 

Florence is borrowing her first loan from KADET, a Kiva partner, and plans to utilize the money in the purchase of fruits for making the juice. Florence operates in a rented store and hopes to open up a permanent premises in the future.

She hopes to venture into selling the actual fruits too, and stop depending on the juice only.

loans.use: Purchasing fruits for making juices

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es:
Gladys Estela C. A. L. tiene 25 años, es soltera,  no tiene hijos,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Gladys  trabaja en la agricultura y ayuda en el hogar a su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, arbeja, fréjol.   Vende los productos en la  Parroquia de San Pablo y en el Cantón San Miguel.
Gladys solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes  para sus cultivos.  Su meta es mejorar la producción para tener mayor rendimiento en ganancias económicas. Los desafíos que enfrentan son los cambios climáticos que pueden perjudicar sus sembrios. Gladys manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela C. A. L. is 25 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba”. The group consists of 25 members, most of whom are engaged in agriculture. Gladys is a farmer and helps support her family financially. Among the crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. She sells her products in San Pablo Parish and San Miguel Canton.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her crops. Her goal is to improve production so that she can generate more revenue. The challenges that Gladys confronts are the changes in weather than can negatively impact her crops. In her free time, Gladys says she enjoys listening to music and helping with the household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Alicia is married and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as candies, eggs, noodles, salt, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily P. is from the town of Albur. She is 52 years old, married to Geronimo, and has four children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a business venture preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Emily has been engaged in her business for over two years now.
Emily joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Todos Juntos Podemos 1 Group

texts.en:
Zoila is the coordinator of her group "Todos juntos podemos 1" (All together we can, group number 1), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. There is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and other economic activities, while running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and her two children.

Zoila is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and improved her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rices, flour and other foods. Her business is a "colmado" - a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally colmados such as this are in the same neighborhood, or within a short walk, from any home. She will use the profits to change her house from wood to concrete blocks so as to give a safer home to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rices, flour and other products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair the roof and the bathroom

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people have selected Mrs. Seng U. as village bank president. They live in Chonloat Dai village, TaK. province, and they will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Seng U., who was born in 1969, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to support her family. She is also a silk tier for weaving, while her husband, Mr. Seng Hort B., is a rock breaker and a construction worker. Now she wants to breed pigs, but she does not have enough money. To solve this problem, Mrs. Seng U. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets and pig feed to start a new business. She is the mother of four children: one is a driver while the others are enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Jesus Cares Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Anybody in Uganda would be exhilarated at the prospect of running a business venture whose weekly profits add up to 140,000 shillings. With enough resourcefulness and a sense of purpose, a certain 45-year-old married father of five, going by the name of K. Pascoli, has found himself in this enviable position for the last twenty-five years In Kyaliwajjala, Mukono.

Pascoli’s shoemaking and sales business has, in a way, propelled him to some considerable financial glory, notwithstanding the fact that he, in most cases, faces problems of shortage of shoemaking materials. This has often been his biggest undoing. Despite this, he has made sure that his family of his wife and five kids bask in the modest glow of his business.

This was Pascoli’s first business and he started it after apprenticeship training in a shoemaking factory. With this loan, he wants to restock his business. This, in essence, means he wants to purchase more leather shoemaking material. This, he says, will enable him make more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more leather shoemaking material

loans.name: Slamas

texts.en:
Mrs. Slamas H., is a widow with one son who assists his mother in the fish business. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
