Mrs. Slamas H. has been selling fish for more than nineteen years. She buys them from fisherman along the Mekong River for resale to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Slamas has had Kiva loan several times already. As she wants to expand her business and generate more income, she is requesting another loan of 1,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To expand her fish business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, tea, sugar, egg, bread and butter

loans.name: Juan Aureliano

texts.es: El Sr. Juan T. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como Técnico de proyectos en la Alcaldía Municipal donde tiene dos años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Juan T. is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  For the past two years he has been working as a project technician at the town hall.  

This is his first loan with Ceprodel.  He plans to buy cement and sand and to pay for labor to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand and to pay for labor

loans.name: Carlotta

texts.en:
Carlotta F. and her husband, Daniel, started a piñata store in August 2007 after Carlotta lost her job at a car dealership. When she joined the ranks of the growing number of unemployed in Floresville, this mother of seven children realized that her dream of starting her own business was now the most practical alternative. Santana’s Party Supplies started out as a piñata store, but quickly grew into a general party supply store, renting out chairs, tables, moonwalks and water slides. 

Their current inventory is insufficient to meet the public’s demand for wedding decorations. Therefore, Carlotta and Daniel are going to use this loan to buy white chairs and tables, arches, columns, and other wedding decorations to rent out. Previously, they had sub-leased these items from party supply stores in San Antonio and barely made a profit. Now, they will be able to avoid the commute to San Antonio and have wedding decorations readily available for customers. 

A constant challenge is the competition of large big-box stores like Wal-Mart. The Fites overcome this challenge by maintaining competitive prices and building relationships with their customers. The couple eventually plans to open up more party supply businesses in southern Texas and give a business to each of Carlotta's children.

loans.use: To buy wedding equipment and decorations

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is from Banga, South Cotabato, has had her farm since 2008. She started her business with very little funding and wants to expand her harvest. Funding from CEVI would enable her to meet her goal for expanding her business and allow her to buy fertilizers and seeds. This would increase her yield.

The additional income would help Elizabeth to better provide for her family's daily needs and new business opportunities.

loans.use: Seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 8 and 4. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives and need assistant.  In 2002, Mohamed established his Men's Wears business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,176,000 SSL every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan of 4,000,000. He has a good loan repayment history. He requires a loan in order to buy jeans, shirt and polo clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately  235,200SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to improve on his business so that he can rent a bigger shop and to educate his children.   He thanks you for your support

loans.use: The loan is use to buy men's wears such as shoes, shirts and polo cloths

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 44 years old and married. To make a living, Conchita runs a general store, where she sells a variety of products in the local community.

Conchita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
T. Trương Thị T. (20209050047) is a 30 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Trương Thị T. (20209050047) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita T. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Isabelita owns & operates a crop raising business, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Isabelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
V. Mahbuba is 51 years old, married and has eight children. Her husband is a teacher, and the couple is committed to ensuring that its children have everything they need. For the last 16 years, Mahbuba has made a living selling fabrics used in the making of her country's national dresses, which are an important item in the dowry of any young woman. She is known for providing outstanding service and selling well-made, carefully-chosen merchandise at good prices. She buys her fabrics in the neighboring city Khujand, where she regularly searches for items that meet her customers' needs. She is applying for a loan to expand her business because her children are growing up and her expenses are rising. She plans to use this loan for TJS 13,000 to buy more items to sell, and thanks Kiva lenders for their generous support. She promises to repay the loan on time.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dikson

texts.en:
Dikson is a 42-year-old man who is running a “motor-taxi” business.  Dikson lives with his wife and two children in a modest house. The children are Jeanet, aged 17 years, and Richard, who is 15. Both attend school. 

Besides running the motor-taxi business, Dikson also runs a billiard business. He realizes that both of his children will have a huge cost for school, while his motor-taxi business can only provide food for his family. The income from his billiard business is also unstable. These situations sometimes make him distressed and he tries hard to find another way to generate additional income.

Dikson decided to go to a cooperative to get a loan. He wanted to buy a tent and chairs to rent out. The cooperative offers an attractive package, but the interest remains high. Dikson then heard about TLM's program from the field officer and got interested in joining the individual program. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He plans to use the loan to develop his leasing business. He expects the loan could help him in improving his business and he can provide easy access to a tent and chairs for the community around his village when they have a party or other events.

loans.use: To buy a tent and chairs to lease out

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the village of Flores, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised hogs.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale during the school term

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 46 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijas independientes. Es propietaria de su casa la cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco con los ingresos  que ha obtenido de su trabajo. Vive en Monsefú ubicado a más de cuarenta minutos de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 10 años, Sabina se dedica a la producción de artesanía, como sombreros, los cuales vende en el parque de Monsefú. Una de sus hijas la apoya en la fabricación de sus productos. Sabina es muy conocida en la zona por su negocio y cuenta con una clientela muy fidelizada que siempre pide sus productos. 

Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más materiales para la fabricación de su artesanía. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 46, is single and has two independent daughters.  She owns her house, which she has been building little by little with the income she has gotten from her work.  She lives in Monsefú, which is over 40 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For over ten years Sabina has been making handicrafts like hats that she sells in the Mansefú park.  One of her daughters helps her make her products.  Sabina is very well known for her business in the zone .  She has very loyal customers who always ask for her products.

She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more materials to make handicrafts.  That is why she believes it is advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,800 soles.

loans.use: To buy raw material to make her handicrafts

loans.name: David Oswaldo

texts.es:
David Oswaldo B. L. tiene 31 años, Es casado vive con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta hace deporte.
texts.en:
David Oswaldo B. L. is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He has no children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton. This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

David grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Comercial Murillo and sells his produce in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops. This financial support helps him meet his needs. He is up against challenges such as plagues, sickness and weather change. His dream is to become more successful in his agricultural business.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Orkhontuya

texts.en:
Orkhontuya is a 28-year-old accomplished and hardworking young woman from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the ger districts of the city with her husband and two kids, ages 5 and 10. Her husband works at a rural geology company and her daughter goes to a kindergarten while her son attends a local public school. 

She started running a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, in 2002. At the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.

However, in 2006, Ms. Orkhontuya had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. As a result of her hard work, today she has 1,200,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in her working capital and she sells her handmade clothes and clothes imported from China.

Orkhontuya is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT. With this loan, she wants to purchase clothing materials and then she will sew spring clothes and women’s coats. Her long term objective is to build her own house where her family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sew spring clothes

loans.name: Calipso Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "CALIPSO  " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 11 personas en la cual 8 son mujeres y 3 varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida,  promotora  de cosméticos, venta de yuca, carbón y repostería  todas viven en la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Juana es la presidenta del banco de emprendimiento Calipso se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, galletas queques y variedad de panes, distribuyendo a los diferentes mercados del plan 3000, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para la elaboracion de tortas, como harina azucar leche, etc tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  vive en  casa propia, los ingresos que generan sustentan su hogar ya que es única fuente de ingresos, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Calipso" is in its first loan cycle with this institution. It is made up of 11 people of which 8 are women and 3 are men. Their businesses range from sale of food, sale of cosmetics, sale of yucca, charcoal and a bakery. All the members live in the area Plan 3000. The group was founded through the initiative of three members. Juana is the president of the communal bank Calipso and she makes cakes, cookies and a variety of breads. She sells them to the different markets in Plan 3000. With this loan she will buy supplies to make cakes such as flour, sugar and milk, etc. Juana has four children who are of school-age. She lives in her own home and the income she generates supports her home since she is the source of income. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Her desire is that her children become professionals and good people. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people that are thankful to this institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour and sugar used to make cakes.

loans.name: Adjoa Mama Gladys

texts.en: Adjoa Mama Gladys M. sells cooked "banku" (fermented corn dough), meat and soft drinks at Elmina. She is married to a teacher and together they live with their three children.  She is responsible for assisting her husband to pay household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more crates of soft drinks for sale. She hopes to plough back her profit into her business.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat is the leader of this group. She is 32 years old and is married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. Their son, 9, is studying at school and their daughter is of pre-school age (under seven). 

In order to earn money for the family, Mahabat takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows.   At the moment, her husband is working in construction, therefore most of the agricultural work fall on Mahabat’s shoulders.  

Mahabat’s has applied for this loan because she needs funds to purchase 100 liters of fuel and some sheep for breeding. In the future, she wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fuel for field work and sheep for breeding

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 51-year-old woman and the mother of eight children from Madaba, Jordan. Asia owns a grocery store where she is interested in offering her customers a larger selection of frozen foods, cold drinks and ice cream products, especially during the summer months. Being a mother of eight children, Asia is all too familiar with the long, hot days of a Jordanian summer without the structure and stimulation that school offers. Asia is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to expand her selection of frozen food, cold drinks and ice cream treats, especially for the neighborhood children. Asia aspires to open a new branch of her store in a prime location; increase her sales; and be able to provide more income for her family. Asia is a conservative woman who prefers to not have her picture published on the internet; so, her husband appears in the photo on her behalf.

loans.use: to expand her product selection

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married with one child. She is 54 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lilia sells different household products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to earn a living.  She has had this business for ten years. Lilia earns PHP 6,000 from her business each month.  She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more products for her general store.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est âgée de 41 ans et vit avec son enfant et son mari qui est cuisinier. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2000 et parallèlement  commercialise aussi des  yaourts qu’elle fait elle-même. Elle vend à domicile et s’approvisionne aussi sur place. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en pagnes et en sacs de lait pour les besoins de son commerce. Elle espère voir agrandir son activité pour de meilleurs lendemains.
texts.en: Afi is 41 years old. She lives with her child and her husband, who works as a cook. She started selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in 2000. As a sideline, she also makes yogurt for sale. She conducts her sales from her home, and gets her supplies locally. This loan will allow her to stock up on pagnes and bags of milk to sustain her activities. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better future.

loans.use: to buy milk and pagnes

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. He earns about PHP 7,500 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Walter grows rice and has been doing this for almost 18 years. Walter is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used to purchase the needed agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Walter hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to have a higher income to finance the education of their children and to satisfy their daily basic needs. He believes that through patience and hard work he can improve their status of living and give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is 31 years old .  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 4.  In 2004, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to expand the inventory of her store. 

 In the future, Rekha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Note: In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called  "pasal", are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her store.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 49 years old. She lives in the village Kvishilori with her husband, Guram, and their son Abessalom, who is 30 years old. Although Abessalom has health problems and receives a pension from the government, he still helps with the family’s farming activities. 

Madona is the leading businesswoman of the family. She grows flowers in her garden and sells them in Tskaltubo, a nearby town. She also has two milk cows and produces cheese to sell at the same market. The average income of the family is 375 GEL.

Madona is requesting a loan to expand her dairy farm and purchase a milk cow which will help increase her cheese production by 50%. This will significantly increase the family’s income. Once she has more income, Madona plans to renovate her house as it is old and needs improvement.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is 27 years of age and married with two children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Fuatino needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Fuatino joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Fuatino's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda, vive con su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad, tiene 9 años de vender comida, este negocio le ayuda para solventar algunas necesidades en su hogar.
Ella solicita por segunda vez un préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda y productos para hacer las meriendas como: bebidas,  carnes, aceite, lácteos y condimentos.
El objetivo de Brenda es que a través de dichos préstamos pueda mejorar su condición de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Brenda lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She has been selling food for nine years.  This business helps her to cover some of her household needs.

Brenda is requesting her second loan to buy merchandise for her store and supplies for making afternoon snacks such as drinks, meat, oil, dairy products and seasonings.

Brenda's goal is, through these loans, to be able to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, oil, dairy products and seasonings

loans.name: Mery Yune

texts.es:
Mery  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Cuneta con educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, cereales, detergentes y jabón.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles comprará mercadería como papa, chuño, maíz, cebada, avena  y otros cereales, la mercadería la compra en Desaguadero, Huacullani y los vende los días domingos en Yunguyo y los martes los vende en la localidad de Juliaca. Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como transportista en mototaxi.
Su sueño es seguir y mejorar  el negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y las ganancias generadas por el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 32 years old, married and has two children.  She completed elementary school.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her initial, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her grocery business in cereals, detergent and soap.

She will use her new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy merchandise like potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, corn, barley, oats and other cereals.  She buys her merchandise in Desaguadero and Huacullani and sells it in the Sunday market in Yunguyo and the Tuesday market in Juliaca.  

She works alone in her business; her husband works as a mototaxi driver.  Her dream is to stay in business to improve it and increase her profits.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings and the profits from savings.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sare Sahara / Kawral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe kawral a été créé en juillet 2008  lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama(assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle a en charge  une belle fille.

Elle vendeuse de lait caillé dans les marchés  hebdomadaire aux environs de son village. Activité qu’elle exerce de puis plus d’une décennie.


Son prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner en lait pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui serviront et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales et d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Kawral group was formed in July 2008 just after the local credit association was founded. The group is made up of 14 women who all live in the same village. They are all sales women by trade. 

Madame Mariama (sitting on the far right) is the group leader. She is 53 years old, married, has 8 children, and also has a step-daughter in her care. She sells curds in the weekly markets in the nearby towns, and has been involved in this trade for over a decade. 

Her loan will enable her to purchase milk for re-sale. The profits that she generates will enable her to support her husband with the family expenses, and to put some money aside as savings.

loans.use: to purchase milk for re-sale

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a labourer. For six years Phung has operated a store/cafe in front of her house.

Phung would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and other products such as packaged foods to stock her store/cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Phung also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy beverages and other products such as packaged food to stock her store.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Marlene has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, D. 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía D. Raúl, su esposo desD. hace 11 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo D. Conopa. Como padres responsables, desean una buena educación para sus hijos; por ello alquilaron un cuarto en L. ciudad D. Huancayo, dónD. sus hijos puedan estudiar. Todas estas responsabilidades lo asumen juntos, como pareja. Su esposo, trabaja en el trasporte público con el carro que posee, su ruta es muy larga, por lo que a veces tarda un día en regresar a su casa, ahí obtiene una ganancia D. 100 soles como mínimo al día. Aún están terminando D. pagar el carro que compraron con esfuerzo. Por su lado Carmen, se dedica a L. agricultura con L. siembra D. papa, habas, maíz y arveja e sus terrenos propios, los que en cada cosecha comercializa en L. feria D. L. localidad D. Acostambo. Además cría vacas y cerdos en cantidad, los que enseba para luego comercializarlo a los carniceros que visitan su zona. Ahora elL. desea mejorar sus ingresos y terminar D. pagar su carro, pues es su principal preocupación. ElL. pertenece al grupo solidario “Conopa” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donD. está muy contenta D. saber que recibirá el apoyo que tanto necesita. Además cultiva L. responsabilidad en su asociación, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cutas.  Carmen comenzará con su sembrío, por ello D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. un toro para arar L. tierra, pues cuenta solo con uno y necesita dos.
texts.en: Carmen, who is 29 years old, is a hardworking woman.  She lives in the company of Raúl, her husband of 11 years.  They have 3 children, who they care for in their own house, which is located in the Conopa annex.  As responsible parents, they hope to give their children a good education.  And so they rented a room in the city of Huancayo where the children can study.  They take on all their responsibilities together, as partners.  Carmen's husband works in transportation using the car he owns.  His route is very long, and so sometimes it takes an entire day for him to get back home.  He earns a minimum of 100 soles a day.  They are still finishing up paying off the car, which took a lot of effort to purchase.  Carmen, on the other hand, makes her living in agriculture.  She plants potatoes, beans, corn and peas on her own land.  She sells her produce after each harvest in Acostambo's market.  In addition, she raises a lot of cows and pigs which she fattens to later sell to the butchers who visit the area.  For now, she hopes to improve her profits and finish paying off the car, which is her primary concern.  Carmen belongs to the communal bank “Conopa,” and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will receive the help that she really needs.  In addition, she encourages responsibility in the association, which is why she promises to be punctual in making her payments.  Carmen will start with her plantings, and once she receives the support, she will invest the money in the purchase of a bull to plow the land.  She currently has one bull, but she needs two.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Muungano A Group

texts.en:
Jacob is the facilitator of the Muungano A group. Jacob and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jacob takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to grow enough to feed his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacob had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Jacob was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacob and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jacob will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Muungano A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Jacob is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 39 years old and married with two children. She is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Geraldine runs a general store in the local community, selling a variety of food and home use products such as candies and cigarettes, etc. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month.

In 2009, Geraldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Geraldine is requesting a loan of PHP 4,550, which she will use to purchase new items and expand the product offerings in her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to expand the product offerings in her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, she has operated a boutique business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another boutique business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase new clothes, handbags and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes, handbags and shoes for resale

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar es un señor de 40 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Oldemar está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Oldemar aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 
Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Oldemar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Oldemar is a 40-year-old man living with his family in a community in southern Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on animal husbandry activities where the farming of tubers, coffee, corn, beans and raising livestock predominate.

Oldemar is asking for a ₡500.000 (five-hundred thousand colones) loan to provide crop maintenance through manure and fungicides to protect his crops of beans since this is reliable and sustainable alternative.  With the manure Oldemar will increase the capacity the soil has for absorbing various nutrients and with the fungicides he’ll use thanks to this loan he will prevent fungus from appearing in his plants so that when his customers ingest them they will be safe from acquiring any disease and thus he will provide quality products for his customers.  He will reach the monthly sales goals he has set.  In addition, he will have enough to cover all his obligations and payments as well as support his extensive family.  Oldemar is a member of the Danta, S.A., communal bank, one of the 150 communal credit firms in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Pedro, quienes vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Francisca es una de la integrantes de este grupo, ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, a la cual siempre van todos sus vecinos. Ella nos dice que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo, sumado a los buenos precios de su negocio, la han ayudado a abrirse camino y tener mejores ingresos. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo y llegar a tener una gran tienda.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lácteos, carne, frutas, hortalizas y otros artículos de primera necesidad, con los cuales podrá abastecerse para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee was formed with the meeting of various residents of the city of San Pedro, who saw a great opportunity in the enterprising women's program of the Fundación Paraguaya. All the members of the committee do independent activities, but they also do activities together that strengthen their unity. 

Francisca is one of the members of this group. She tells us that she has a small, well stocked store where her neighbors always go. She tells us that thanks to her hard work and dedication, as well as her business' good prices, she has been able to make her way and have more income. One of her goals is to keep growing and have a great store.

She is asking for the loan to buy dairy products, meat, fruit, produce, and other basic necessity products. With these she can stock her store and be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, fruit, produce, and other items.

loans.name: Anyela Yuliana

texts.es:
Anyela Yuliana vive en Camaná, Perú, un oasis en el otro modo de largo y seco desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares. En sus tiempos libres disfruta mucho de pasear por las hermosas playas de camana sobre todo porque la relaja mucho, comop el Peru es un país de una gastronomía exquisita a Anyela le gusta mucho El Ceviche, ella es profesora de matematicas, y nos comenta que de niña no le gustaba para nada, es por ello que cuando enseña a sus alumnos lo hace con mucha paciencia.

Anyela trabaja dictando clases particulares de matematica, trabaja alrededor de 5 horas diarias y enseña alrededor de 12 alumnos por días, en un dia puede ganar hasta S/. 50 pero en un dia muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/.84 pero ella nos dice que aveces da facilidades a los padres de sus alumnos porque mas que todo ella quiere que los niños aprendan y estén bien en la escuela, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha paciencia con los alumnos y porque los padres le tienen mucha confianza.

Anyela esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias su auda ella podrá comprar sillas y muebles para dictar sus clases, esta mejora permitira que sus alumnos estén mas comodos y poder tener más alumnos que enseñar, asi podrá tenr mas ingresos y ahorrar para cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Anyela Yuliana lives in Camaná, Peru, which is an oasis in the otherwise long and dry desert of Sechura that dominates the southwestern part of the country. Camaná has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru, however, the frequent and strong earthquakes and tsunamis during the last decade (8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) destroyed the tourism business in Camaná, with the loss of many jobs, ways of making a living, and homes.

In her free time she very much enjoys walking the beautiful beaches of Camaná, most of all because it is very relaxing. Peru is a country with delicious food and Anyela likes ceviche a lot. She is a professor of mathematics, and tells us that as a child she didn’t like it at all, and this is why when she is teaching her students she does it with a lot of patience.

Anyela provides private math classes, working around 5 hours daily and teaching around 12 students per day. In a day she can earn up to S/.50 but in a good day she can earn up to S/.84 but she tells us that sometimes she makes it easier for the parents of her students because most of all she wants her students to learn and do well in school. She thinks that things are going well in her business because she has a lot of patience with the students and because the parents have a lot of confidence in her.

Anyela is very grateful as a Kiva borrower and thanks to the help she can buy chairs and furniture in order to teach her classes. This enhancement will permit her students to be more comfortable and for her to have more students to teach, and thus she can have more income and savings in order to fulfill her biggest dream, “having her own home.”

loans.use: to buy chairs and furniture for her classes

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es: Ana Marisol de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia; ella posee una pequeña farmacia donde vende medicamento para todo tipo de síntoma, dolor de cabeza, de estómago, nauseas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa en las ventas, el negocio se ubica en su residencia, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de  primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable siempre está a la orden de las personas que lo visitan; Ana Marisol es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan llegar al éxito, su más grande sueño es ver crecer el negocio sabe que así aumentaran las ventas y al mismo tiempo las ganancias; necesita de capital para invertir en nuevos medicamentos por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar medicina por mayor. Ana Marisol tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: medicina por mayor

loans.name: Salha

texts.en: Salha is a 38 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Khaledieh Al Mafraq Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements,she would like to build a roof for her home.In the future she hopes to improve her family living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA UNION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa Maria ella es casada y tiene 41 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales,perfumes,cremas entre otros, la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas pero no le fue muy bien porque al mes no vendía muchos animales y no le alcanzaba para estudios de sus hijos pero este negocio de venta de productos de belleza le va muy bien, la socia ya tiene 3 años en este negocio de venta de productos de belleza, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas y lápiz labiales al por mayor.
Los otros socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo ya que ellos no pudieron asistir el dia de la reunion porque sus jefes no les  quisieron dar permiso para que vayan a ala reunion.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de tejas, negocio de venta de chicha y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to La Unión Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Rosa María, 41, is married and has three children.  She works with her business selling beauty products.  She sells lipstick, perfume, and creams, among other things.  Previously she raised animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, but it didn't go well for her because she didn't sell many animals in a month and she didn't have enough money for her children's school expenses.  But this business selling beauty products is going very well for her.  She has been in the business for three years.  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her products.

She's requesting the loan to buy perfume, cream, and lipstick wholesale.

The other members who are attached to the group photo had permission to have their photos taken later due to work.  The other members work in arts and crafts, animal sales, tile sales, "chica" [a traditional beverage] sales, and food sales.

The member thanks those who are part of her dream and she promises to make the payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and lipstick wholesale

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida operates a sewing business in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). Vida is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Vida uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

First name will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of sewing materials, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a senior high school graduate, Vida understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sewing materials

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
In God Bondo B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Peter has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser system. Peter is a friendly member of the community with 2 children. Peter lives with his family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and an iron roof.

God Bondo B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Kabongo spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Peter’s family, as well as the 40 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Peter has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Peter volunteered to be the promoter because he wants to help the community prevent sicknesses related to unsafe water. There are also two other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Jane and Dickness.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Peter’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Afi Lawoè

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Afi Lawoè who was born in 1965 in Tabligbo is married and mother of six (06) children. Her husband lost his job early and up to now the burden of taking care of the family has been on her shoulder. She became head of the family owing to the turn of events she started the trade of generic products from Nigeria in order to make ends meet. As she was advised on the dangerous nature of those products, she decided to undergo a training in Chinese pharmacy in 1999. She is a courageous and hardworking woman; she manages her business very well and meets the basic needs of her family despite the difficulties. She has a significant experience in the management of credits as she received three credits of $100, $250 and $550 respectively. She reimbursed promptly with no incident. Mrs. A. Afi Lawoè requested a new credit of $850 to start a rural drug store where she will sell generic product and Chinese drugs. This will allow her to increase revenue and improve the living conditions of her entire family. The demand for such products does exist on the market.

Née en 1965 à Tabligbo, Madame A. Afi Lawoè est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Très tôt, son mari perd jusqu’à ce jour son travail et toutes les charges du foyer reposaient sur elle. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle se lança dans le commerce des produits génériques provenant du Nigeria afin de joindre les deux bouts. Conseillée des méfaits nuisibles de ces produits sur la santé humaine, elle décida alors de se faire formée en pharmacologie chinoise en 1999. Femme très courageuse et travaillant avec endurance et abnégation, elle a su bien maîtriser et gérer son commerce par lequel, elle arrive tant bien que mal à subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille. Madame A. Afi Lawoè a une large expérience dans la gestion des crédits après ses trois crédits respectifs de $100, $250 et $550 obtenus et remboursés promptement sans incident. Madame A. Afi Lawoè sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $850 pour ouvrir une pharmacie villageoise pour vendre les produits génériques et les produits chinois. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille. La demande existe pour ce marché.

loans.use: to start a rural drug store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her mobile food vending business

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil A. was born and raised in the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is the sole supporter of his wife and three children. He has been to some extent involved in the family business of tailoring and alterations for the past 20 years. Habil realized the need to expand his operations and has started working with leather to create belts in addition to making commissioned clothing items. 

Habil is requesting a loan from Normicro to purchase more raw materials and supplies for his shop in order to meet the growing demand of his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Giannina

texts.en:
Giannina Q. was born in Santa Elena 45 years ago. She runs a small stand selling “fast food,” but not in the American sense of the word. There are hamburgers and hot dogs, but more local specialties such as salchipapas can be found at her “restaurant on wheels.” She works every day from 4:00 pm until 11:00 pm.

Q. says she learned this business when she was an employee in a cafeteria at a college. With six years of experience in this line of work, she has her loyal clients who love her special flavors. Q. is asking for a second loan that will help her buy a new cart for her son to start a second branch of her business. With her first loan she bought tables, chairs and a radio to play music for her clients.

loans.use: Buy a second cart

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora belongs to the communal bank "Santa Ana" in Moyabamba, San Martín. She is dedicated to selling beauty products out of her salon where she tends to her friends and other clients who come in daily. She studied cosmetology at a higher-learning institute and decided to start her own business, generate her own income and grow personally and professionally. She's 45 years old and has four children. She's content with what she's accomplished and satisfied by her results up to now as her clientele has risen. Her goal is to complete construction of shops to rent out.

She is requesting a loan of $800, which she will use to improve her salon by purchasing specialized furniture like hair-washing stations and necessary equipment like mirrors, scissors and hair dryers. She also plans to pain her salon and purchase wholesale products from Placenta Life, who provide her most popular and most used products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teodora G. pertenece al Banco Comunal "Santa Ana", radica en Moyabamba, en el Departamento de San Martín, y se dedica la venta de productos de belleza en su salón de estética en donde a tiende a sus amigas (os) y demás clientes que acuden a diario. Estudió Cosmetología en un Instituto Superior por lo decidió iniciar su propio negocio y de esa manera generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y profesional. Tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó. Su meta es completar su proyecto que es la construcción de departamentos para alquilar . El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ( $ 790.00 ), lo invertirá para mejorar su local, comprando muebles especiales para salón de belleza como una lavadora de cabellos, un porta materiales e instrumentos de trabajo y equipos necesarios como espejos, cortadora y secadora de cabello profesional, pintado del local, también comprará productos de belleza al por mayor ( producto Placenta Life) que es la línea que mas vende y usa para atender a sus clientas.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en: My name is Jannat B. and I am a widow and a mother of five children. My eldest son designs and makes furniture. His business yields just enough for us to manage our living and send the children to school. He wants to expand his business so that it will be possible to buy timber in large volume and thus produce more furniture. The increased production will double his income and we will be able to eat better at home. He will especially make more in the wedding season, which is around the corner.

loans.use: Buy timber in bulk

loans.name: Aliboi

texts.ru:
Aliboi has been receiving loans since 2006, he sells rice. He, like many starting businessmen, has been at times running into the grim reality and began to realize that alone he will not be able to take his business to the next level. Maybe the lack of loan opportunities, maybe lack of experience in assessing his the buisness' direction, maybe the fact that he was doing it alone, but in the end our businessman decided to seriously think about the possibility of doing serious business. He decided to turn to Microinvest and to increase his total capital by taking out a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Алибой кредитуется с 2006 года, он торгует рисом. Он как и многие начинающие бизнесмены, начинал свой бизнес, порой сталкивался с суровой реальностью и начинал осознавать, что в одиночку он не в состоянии продвинуть свое дело на следующую ступень. То ли сказывался недостаток финансовых возможностей, то ли опыта в определенном направлении ведения бизнеса, то ли просто в одиночку не осиливал и тогда наш бизнесмен начал серьезно задумываться о возможном серьезном бизнесе. Он обратился в Микроинвест и увеличел свой капитал.

loans.use: selling food stuffs/groceries

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Bertila is a 49 year old single mother of three children. Daily she works to be able to give her youngest son what he needs, with the end goal that he will be able to reach his goal and pursue studies for a career he has chose. She is the owner of a motorcar, additionally she depends on the income from rooms she rents to young people from her community, and this allows her to live comfortably. Keeping in mind that this is dependable income that she counts on month to month she has decided to better the rooms of her small house, and that is why she needs the loan to enable her to better this place with the end goal of making the rooms more comfortable and secure for her tenants. We support Mrs. Rosa Bertila to meet her objective. She will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa Bertila, es madre soltera de 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, el objetivo de su esfuerzo diario es porque desea otorgarle las facilidades necesarias a su menor hijo, a fin de que éste pueda alcanzar su meta y desarrollarse plenamente en la carrera que ha elegido estudiar.Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, además mensualmente cuenta con el ingreso de las habitaciones que otorga en alquiler a jóvenes de su comunidad los cuales le permiten vivir cómodamente. Teniendo en cuenta que este es el ingreso seguro con el que cuenta mes a mes ha decidido mejorar las instalaciones de esta pequeña casa es por eso que ella necesita un capital que le permita mejorar este lugar a fin de brindar mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus inquilinos.Apoyemos a la señora Rosa Bertila a cumplir con su objetivo ella no te defraudará.

loans.use: Repair her vehicle and expand two rooms in order to rent them

loans.name: Kikooza G(Vii) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Annet N..  She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to re-invest in the stone business.  Annet is 38 years old.  She has 6 children ranging from age 4 to 20, and her children go to school.  Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX  in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.  Annet is joined in her small group by Zebulensi Rweneno, Scolastica B., Desire M., and Christine N..  Zebulensi Rweneno is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to expand her stone business.  Scolastica B. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to buy more land for stone quarrying.  Desire M. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to re-invest in her stone business.  Christine N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to expand her stone quarry business.

loans.use: To buy more land to expand the stone quarry business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A.  is a trader who prefers to walk to her customers and sell her goods to them. She sells cosmetics and babywear. She is married to a driver and has 2 children.
She wants to increase her sales so as to increase her income.

She is requesting a loan of $525 as an addition source of funding to invest in her trade.

loans.use: As additional source of funding to invest in her trade.

loans.name: Guldith

texts.es:
Mrs. Guldith N. Rodríguez is a member of the “Banco Comunal, Nuestra Sra. de la Paz”, she lives in the Region of San Martín, Province of San Martín, District of Tarapoto, and her address is Av. Micaela Bastidas No. 335 where her business of groceries- general store also is located. The opportunity of a loan from the “Banco Comunal” will allow her to expand this business and create income in order to help her parents. Doña Guldith is also teaching at a local educational center and when she is absent her mother is taking responsibility for the business.

With the loan of S/.2,000.00 ($725.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, “Kolynos”, toilet paper, boxes of soap and other products to supply her general store. She will also buy raw material to prepare snacks to be sold at her business. Doña Guldith is 39 years old, lives with her parents who she supports in all aspects, and they assist her in the development of the activities of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Guldith N. Rodríguez pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. De la Paz” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en la Av. Micaela Bastidas Nº 335, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. La oportunidad de un préstamo en el Banco Comunal le permite desarrollar este negocio y generar un ingreso para poder ayudar a sus padres, paralelo a este negocio es docente en un centro educativo local, y cuando está ausente su mamá se responsabiliza del negocio.

Con el crédito de S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, Kolynos, papel higiénico, jabones en cajas y otros productos para surtir su bodega , asimismo productos para producir un poco de bocaditos que los expende en su negocio. La señora Guldith tiene 39 años, vive con sus padres a quienes apoya en todo aspecto y quienes le ayudan en el desarrollo de las actividades del negocio.

loans.use: Purchase products to expand business and improve sales.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Robiya S. is a businesswoman who sells clothing. She has been managing a market stall at the central market in Fayzabad for the last six years. Robiya brings clothing from Dushanbe. Her business is doing well but she has a very large family and what she earns is often not enough to support them. Robiya is already 47 years old and she has four children. All of her children are attending school and to be able to give the best education to all of them Robiya has to work a lot. But she is not one to give up and currently she wants to take out a loan to expand her business. She is planing to pay back the loan int he next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Саъдуллоева Робия бизнесмен.Занимается торговлей одежды. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке Файзабада. Занимается этим уже 6 лет. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Получает неплохой доход , но для ее большой семьи не хватает , того что она зарабатывает. Ей 47 лет и у нее 4 детей. Все дети учатся в школе , а для того чтобы дать образование детям, Робия должна много работать. Но она не унывает и теперь планирует получить кредит , погасить который сможет в течении 12 месяцев. На планируемый кредит она хочет увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Miss Aïcha A. was born on September 14, 1977 in Atakpamé in Ogou County. She is single and her primary business is selling cereals in Agoè Assiyéyé market. Her business consists in purchasing from farmers in out-lying farms and selling the cereals she buys in Lomé. She reinvests the profit she makes into her business so that she can have a large inventory. Her goal is to be the biggest cereals merchant in Agoè market.

The loan that she is presently requesting will allow her to purchase 7 sacks of corn containing 60 bowls each.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Aïcha est née le 14 septembre 1977 à Atakpamé dans la préfecture de l’Ogou. Elle est célibataire. Elle a pour activité principale le commerce des céréales dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Son activité consiste à acheter auprès des agriculteurs dans les fermes reculées et de les revendre à Lomé. Avec le revenu que lui procure cette activité, elle réinvestie dans ce commerce pour pouvoir avoir un grand étalage. Son objectif est d’être la plus grande commerçante de céréales dans le marché d’Agoè.

Ainsi le crédit actuel qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter sept (7) sacs de maïs d’une contenance unitaire de 60 bols.

loans.use:
Purchase of 7 sacks of corn

Achat de 7 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Feliciana Judith

texts.es:
Feliciana is a young mother and a professional at the same time. Her vocation as an early childhood teacher goes beyond this role as she understands that she forms these young students for their entire lives. She is very dedicated to her family and loves her work for which she is well prepared as she applies her knowledge by creating educational materials from plastic molded crafts. The quality with which she produces them allows her to improve her work each day which is why her orders have increased. In this occasion Feliciana needs a loan of 1000 soles that will allow her to obtain the raw material for the elaboration of her educational materials. Help Feliciana to move forward with her success.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Feliciana es una joven madre de familia y buena profesional a la vez, su vocación como profesora del nivel inicial trasciende más allá, pues entiende que ella forma a sus pequeños alumnos para toda la vida. Ella es muy dedicada a su familia y ama su trabajo para el cual está preparada, pues aplica sus conocimientos elaborando de manera independiente todo tipo de materiales didácticos a base de corrospum, la calidad con que ella produce le permite mejorar cada día sus trabajos por lo cual sus pedidos van en aumento. En esta ocasión Feliciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que le servirá para obtener la materia prima para la elaboración de sus materiales didácticos. Apoya a Feliciana a continuar adelante con su éxito.

loans.use: To increase raw materials in order to be able to make crafts.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurn C. is a villager in Prey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a garment factory worker who receives a small salary. She is a 36-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. The family members now live in an old house and poor conditions, so Mrs. Soeurn C. decided to ask for a loan to hire a house worker to build her a new house in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire house worker to build her a new house in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Dina Yawa

texts.fr: Dina Yawa A. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est couturière à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et aussi des tissus pour les revendre à ses clients. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dina Yawa A. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She works as a seamstress in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, she hopes to buy a sewing machine, as well as fabric to sell to her clients. This will allow her to earn more money and better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, and fabric for resale

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail K., 38, is married and has two children. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She makes her sales by 'hawking,' which is door-to-door sales. Abigail is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets. 

She is a member of the community group called Judah Trust Group. In this group, the members assist one another to guarantee repayment of the loans. This photograph was taken after a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 41 años de edad, estudió segundo grado de primaria, es casada, madre de 05 hijos (uno con familia y cuatro solteros), vive en el Barrio Miraflores, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno y desde hace un año y medio es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

En un inicio, con un préstamo de S/.300, compró papa, chuño, arroz y verduras para cocinar en su restaurante. Sus padres eran pobres y ellas eran 06 hermanas que no pudieron estudiar. Crecieron al lado de otras personas y desde los 16 años de edad salió a vender frutas y golosinas en Conduriri. A los 18 años tuvo su pareja e instaló un restaurante que hasta la fecha viene funcionando, también se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca conjuntamente con su esposo, entrega semanalmente a los mayoristas de Tacna entre 04 y 05 degollados.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 07 degollados de carne, dependiendo del precio el cual oscila entre S/.120 y S/.150 cada uno.

Su meta es poner una tienda de abarrotes en Conduriri y que sus hijos menores estudien para que puedan trabajar.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 41, went to second grade, is married, has five children (one with family and four single), she lives in the Miraflores neighbourhood, district of Conduriri, province of El Collao, Puno, and has been for a year a member of the community bank “Maria Parado de Bellido” in Conduriri. At the beginning, with a $100 loan, she bought potatoes, rice, vegetables to cook in her restaurant. Her parents were poor and had six daughters that couldn’t study. They grew up around other people and at 16 she went to sell fruits and snacks in Conduriri. At 18, she met her partner and started a restaurant that to this date is still up and running, she also buys and sells alpaca meat with her husband, they make weekly deliveries to wholesalers in Tacna, delivering four to five of them. With this loan of $325, to be repaid in three months, she will buy seven alpacas for meat, depending on the price, which varies between 40 and 50 each. Her goal is to have a general store in Conduriri and to see her young children study and be able to get a job.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpaca meat to sell

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Асоева Маьлюба проживает в Гиссарском районе в поселке Мирзо Ризо. Возраст 25 лет, не замужем. Обратилась к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Она недавно окончила курсы  шитья и поэтому решила открыть свое дело, то есть заняться пошивом национальной одежды на заказ. Ее бизнес поможет населению ее кишлака пользоваться данными услугами, не выезжая за приделы кишлака.
texts.en:
Matluba A. lives in the village of Mirzo Rizo in the Gissar District. She is 25 years old and unmarried. She came to us for a loan to buy a sewing machine. She recently finished studying sewing and so has decided to open her own tailoring business, making traditional clothing to order. Her business will provide village residents local access to these services.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Because her husband is working in Mindanao, another region in the Philippines, Teresita and her six year old daughter live apart from him.
