She has operated a community-based variety store for the past three years, and it is open from 6:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening. Teresita is now requesting a loan to buy stocks such as soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar and other basic commodities for her store. She expects that this will increase her daily income and ultimately give her and her husband the chance to have a better life and support their child's education.

One of Teresita’s dreams is to have a grocery store, which is so much bigger than a community-based village store, so that she can sell a variety of commodities in her community. She also prays that her husband will find work in the area so that they can support their only daughter together.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nancy Violeta

texts.es: La señora Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora, que además de ser madre soltera siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante y enseñarle a su hijo que en la vida hay que saber trabajar, ella labora en una clínica de la ciudad en el área de lavandería  desde hace 5 años, su hijo trabaja como cobrador de una compañía con una antigüedad de 2 años, ellos como familia están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas de su casa ya que esa se les acaba de entregar y desean tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Nancy is a hard-working person, who, in addition to being a single mother, has worked to go forward and teach her son that in life, one should know how to work. She has worked in a clinic in the city near a laundromat for 5 years. Her son has worked as a conductor in a company for two years. As a family, they are requesting this loan to put protections on the doors and windows of their house since they have just moved and want to have more protection.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put protections on the doors and windows

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita trabaja con su esposo en la rama de carpintería; elaboran juegos de living con la ayuda de sus dos hijos mayores; dicha mercadería es comercializada en la ciudad de La Paz, convirtiéndose esta actividad en su fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que están en los últimos años de la secundaria. Rita tiene su casa propia que aún no está completamente terminada  y está ubicada en la zona de Villa Alemania en  la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción para así terminar los cuartos que aún están inconclusos en su vivienda.
 
Este será su segundo crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Rita works with her husband in the carpentry business; they make living room furniture sets with the help of their two older children. The furniture they produce is sold in the city of La Paz; this is their primary source of income that covers the household costs for their three children who are still in high school. Rita has her own home which is still not completely finished, but is located in the Villa Alemania zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy construction materials to finish the unfinished rooms of her home. This is her second loan from Impro; her punctual payments on her previous loan showed that she is worthy of receiving another.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, paint, etc.) to finish the unfinished rooms in her home

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn K. is 39 years old and she lives in Ba Koung Khang Koert village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Pha Sambo, is a traditional medicine seller. Although they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support the family.

Thus, Mrs. Sokhorn K. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a cow

loans.name: Deysy

texts.es: Deysy de 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres y los ayuda en todas las tareas del hogar, es una joven alegre y tiene muchas ganas de progresar y mejorar su vida. Aprendió desde muy niña el negocio familiar, la crianza de truchas es en la actividad para la que más preparada está, muy de mañana empieza su labor, teniendo que remar y abrirse camino a través del lago Titicaca, para alimentar a sus truchas, que es justamente lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, ya que mientras transporta el alimento, puede disfrutar de los hermosos paisajes que se forman en el lago. Deysy anhela incrementar el número de truchas que cría, para poder exportarlas y así mejorar sus ingresos, tiene un año realizando esta labor y lo que menos le gusta es el olor de la comida que le da a sus truchas, aunque sabe que tiene que hacerlo, ya que si no lo hiciera su negocio no progresaría. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Deysy invertirá los setecientos soles que solicita en su negocio de truchas, comprará más alimento y mejorará sus jaulas.
texts.en:
Deysy is 21 years old and lives with her parents and helps them with the household chores. She is a happy young woman and has a strong desire to advance and improve her life. She learned the family business as a child, trout farming is the activity that she is best qualified for. She starts work very early in the morning, making her way out to lake Titicaca to feed the trout, which is her favorite part of the job, because as she transports the food she can enjoy the beautiful scenery surrounding the lake. Deysy wants to increase the number of fish she raises, to be able to export them and increase her profits. She has been in this business for a year, and the part she likes least is the smell of the food she gives to the fish, although she knows she must do it, or her business will not grow. This is her first loan with MFP, she is very happy to have obtained it and is dedicated to making all of her payments on time. She is very active in her communal bank, and is always aware of the agreements reached at their meetings. Deysy will invest this money in her trout business, buying more food and improving their tanks.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her trout farming business

loans.name: Sewa (La Joie) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sewa  est composé de huit femmes qui ont en moyenne 42 ans,  6  enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou. 
Les femmes du groupe Sewa sont de vraies commerçantes d’articles divers, elles vendent un peu de tout (des tasses, des parures, du dah rouge, du beurre de karité et  des habits qui sont à la mode.) 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100 000.pour ce sixième prêt solidaire. Tous les précédents prêts ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter de  Lomé (la capitale togolaise) des tasses thermos, des glacières et tissus wax en gros. En partance pour Lomé elles amènent en fonction des demandes  du dah rouge, du beurre de karité etc. Ces femmes vendent leurs produits  à la maison, au marché de San, de Kifosso et dans les villages tout autours.
Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser chacune au cours de ce cycle 120 000FCFA. de bénéfice qui servira à étoffer le fonds de commerce.
Elles ambitionnent devenir des  commerçantes import export..
texts.en:
The Sewa (Joy) group is composed of eight women who are on average 42 with 6 children, and live in polygamous families in the village of Kimparana, prefecture of San, Ségou region.

The women of the Sewa group are true saleswomen in the field of general merchandise. They sell a little of everything: bowls, costume jewelry, dried red hibiscus flowers, karité (shea) butter, and stylish clothing.

To expand the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. The amount they are allowed to borrow has gone from 50,000 F CFA for their first loan to 100,000 F CFA for this 6th solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been reimbursed without difficulty.

The present loan will be used to buy wholesale, in Lomé, the Togolese capital: thermos jugs, coolers, and "wax" African print cloth. On leaving for Lomé, they bring with them, according to the orders they have, dried hibiscus flowers, karité (shea) butter, etc. These women sell their products out of their homes, at the San and Kifosso marketplaces, and in the surrounding villages.

With this new loan they are each expecting to make 120,000 F CFA in profit during the loan cycle which will be used to bolster their working capital.

Their ambition is to become import export merchants.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira L. sells used-clothing in her village. She retails ready-to-wear (RTW) items in order to have enough income to support her family. Aside from clothes, she also sells fish to supplement her income. Elvira is 25 years old. She was a sales clerk before in Tagbilaran Bohol but stopped working there because of low compensation. She is married and has two children.

Elvira is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy RTW items to sell. In addition to clothes, part of the loan will be used to buy fish to sell. The loan will help Elvira's family to grow her businesses.


CEVI is reaching out to small entrepreneurs to sustain their livelihood. It provides not just loans, but also credit, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing and fish to sell

loans.name: Wanzela

texts.en: Wanzela S. is a married woman with two school-age children. She runs a grocery store in Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She sells a wide variety of soft drinks. She fills her family's daily needs with the income from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz vive en el Asentamiento Humano  5 de Abril en la Mz. B Lt. 27, ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “ FRUTO BENDITO”, tiene 31 años y vive con  sus 5 hijos ,su esposo  trabaja haciendo colectivo con su bote a motor y Liz lo acompaña en el trabajo.

El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, esto le permitió arreglar su bote para dar comodidad a sus pasajeros y así tener mas clientes y más ingresos económicos para el hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles lo que invertirá en la compra de un nuevo motor para su bote, telas para las cortinas y  también comprará pintura para pintar el bote para que se vea mas bonito y llevar mas turistas a pasear.

Con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos podré generar mayor ingreso económico a mi hogar ya que brindaré mejor servicio, comodidad y  seguridad a mis pasajeros y a la vez tendré mas clientes.
texts.en:
Liz lives in the April the 5th settlement and belongs to the Blessed Fruit cooperative bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her 5 children. Her husband works transporting passengers on a motorized boat, and Liz joins him in this endeavor. She received her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos, and this allowed her to repair her boat and provide more comfort for passengers. This, in turn, helped to generate more income for the household. She will invest this loan of 1,000.00 soles into the purchase of a new motor for her boat, fabric for curtains, and also paint to fix up the boat so it will look more appealing and draw tourists who want to sightsee. “With the loan from Manuela Ramos, I’ll have more financial stability for my family as I can generate more revenue from my business by providing a better service, as well as added comfort and safety, for my customers. This will then also help me to attract more clientele”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor for her boat.  To have her boat painted.  To buy fabric for curtains.

loans.name: Rosa Lily

texts.es:
ROSA LILY R. D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo palma Nº 225, tiene 65 años D. edad,  4 hijos mayores y su esposo es albañil.

Tiene 8 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cuál lo utilizó para comprar ropas usadas para posteriormente venderlo por la carretera Federico Basadre y así poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra  D. todo tipo D. ropa usada para luego ir a venderlo en la ciudad D. Neshuya y Curimana.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque le otorgó un crédito sin tanto papeleo, confía en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lily R. D. M. is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women United) Village Bank. She lives at 225 Jr. Ricardo D. Palma. She is 65 and has 4 grown children. Her husband is a bricklayer. She's been with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy used clothing to sell along the Federico Basadre highway, allowing her to continue developing her small business. Rosa plans to use this loan of 1,500 soles to buy all kinds of used clothing to take to sell in the cities of Neshuya and Curimana. She is grateful Manuel Ramos for giving her a loan without too much paperwork, trusting her, and motivating her to be responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of used clothing.

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
Mrs. Mam M. is aged 60, and is the widowed mother of seven children: five are single and the others are married and live separately. Two of her children are employed: a son is working in construction and daughter is a garment worker in Phnom Penh.

Presently, Mam M. cultivates rice and vegetable crops, and sells her mature produce to a buyer every two or three months after she plants them. She requests the Kiva loan in order to purchase a pumping machine to irrigate her farm field. She will rent this machine out to other farmers for additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine to irrigate her farm field

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor P. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Nestor is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nestor owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling home products, such as shampoos, rice, milk, soaps and many others. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Nestor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Nestor is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks for his retail store (sari-sari). This will be the 6th loan taken out by Nestor from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for the Sari-Sari Store

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa M. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo tai.  She is married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Epenesa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Epenesa has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Epenesa is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Epenesa from SPBD.  Epenesa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego T. is 39 years old fisherman and father of 5 children. His eldest son is 19 years old on October and he really likes the services offered by Community Economic Ventures Inc. By availing another loan in CEVI, he hopes to buy fishing materials and boat engine since those that he used are already old. With this loan, he will also be able to send his children to school and provide some of their needs at home.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and boat engine

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Edina M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 20. Edina has been running a business purchasing and selling cereals since 1999. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 100 USD from her business. Edina is requesting a loan in order to purchase cereals in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. She thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Gena

texts.en: Gena C. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Gena owns and operates a business running a "balot" food stall in the local community. A balot or balut is a fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. Gena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosa Luzmila

texts.es: La señora Rosa Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vendedoras D. Villa Universitaria”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y 01 hijos,  que aun dependen D. ella.Se dedica a la venta D. cuyes vivos, iniciándose con un capital D. S/. 90.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio,  ubicada en su misma casa, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y esta muy  contenta con lo que hace.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará maíz molido, gramas panca D. maíz(cholo), jaulas, bebederos.Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres D. la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Rosa Luzmila is a member of the “Las Vendedoras D. Villa Universitaria” [The Vendors of University Villa] Communal Bank, Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 50 years old and married with one child, who is still dependent on her. Her business is selling live guinea pigs. She started with 90 Peruvian soles as capital, and today she continues to operate the same business, located within her own home. She tells us that her business is going very well, and she is very happy with her work. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, she will purchase ground corn, corn stalks, cages, and water troughs. She feels very satisfied, since in spite of the difficulties, she and her family have been able to get ahead. For this, she thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for the valuable support it has provided to her and to other women in the San Martín region.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food and supplies for her animals

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married and is a mother with five children. She is 30 years old and currently living with her husband and the children.

Georgina is a very hardworking woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts and meat pies in her neighborhood and flip-flops (sandals) and sachet mineral water (water in plastic bags) in a rented kiosk. The pastries are prepared from flour and are mostly purchased by her loyal customers. She treats her customers with care and combines the sale of pastries with the sale of flip-flops.

Georgina treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods, especially the flip-flops. She requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine, etc., to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a stock of flour, margarine, cooking oil, slippers and sachet water in bulk

loans.name: Ofelia Marina

texts.es: La Señora tiene 39 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Artesana,  “Confección de delantales”, habita junto  con sus hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un Taller del mismo oficio, llevan  16 años de laborar su residencia  se encuentra en el  Paraje Choescuela, Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Handicrafts. Apron Manufacturing. The lady is a 39-year-old, married woman. She lives with her children. Her children and she share the same occupation. They have a workshop and have been working for 16 years. They live in Paraje Choescuela, Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán department, Guatemala, Currently, demand from their customers has increased but their economic situation has precluded their being able to invest capital to meet demand. For this reason she has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing which will be used to buy raw materials to increase sales hoping, too, to help her family get ahead and have improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 36 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de uno de sus familiares.
Desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad (comestibles), para ello acondicionó un espacio de su vivienda, donde presta atención durante casi todo el día.
Este negocio es muy cómodo para ella, pues está en su casa y disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos. Rocío siempre está al tanto de todo lo que se necesite para abastecer su tienda con la cantidad necesaria de mercadería, y debido al buen trato que ofrecer ha logrado que su clientela vaya en aumento
Durante estos dos años de trabajo, Rocío ha visto los resultados de su trabajo y ello la anima a seguir invirtiendo en al crecimiento de su tienda. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal y tiene grande expectativas de realizar un trabajo solidario para el progreso de todo el grupo. El dinero que solicita le servirá para comprar más mercadería, especialmente en panetones (queque con pasas y frutas), chocolate para taza y tarros de leche, productos muy demandados en la época navideña que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Rocío, 36, lives with her children in a relative's house. For the last two years she has run a grocery store from a space she equipped in her dwelling. She tends to customers almost the entire day. This line of work is very comfortable for her because she can work from home and enjoy the company of her children. Rocío is always careful to see that her store is stocked with all the merchandise she needs and, thanks to the good customer service she provides, her regular clientele has been steadily growing. During these two years of work she has seen the results of her good work and she is motivated by them to continue investing in her store's growth. This is her first financing with MFP and she is very happy to be part of a comunal bank; she has high expectations of working well in a group so that all the members can progress. The funds requested will be used to buy stock inventory, especially panetones (a traditional cake made with raisins and fruits), hot chocolate mix, jars of milk, and other often requested items for the approaching Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Nasera

texts.en:
Nasera Z. sells bread and charcoal from her home. She is requesting a loan to buy more baking flour so she can make more bread and cakes to sell.  Nasera is 40 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy baking flour for bread and cakes

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Carmela es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Carmela tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende verduras, carne, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además viaja a las ferias de la selva ayacuchana en donde vende bebidas entre otros productos.
Carmela necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Carmela son comprar un carro para transportar su mercadería y que brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Communal Bank “Fraternidad” (Fraternity). She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.

Carmela operates a grocery store out of her home where she sells vegetables, meat, and fruit. She manages her business every day with the help of her daughter. In addition, she travels to fairs in the Ayacuchan jungle where she sells beverages and other products.

Carmela needs a loan of 750 soles in order to purchase milk, rice, and sugar. Among her dreams are to purchase an automobile for transporting her merchandise and to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda N., âgée de 32 ans est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois KIR-DIOM depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Avec son prêt elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle achète des bœufs les déparasite avec des produits vétos, les engraisse et les revend au bout de 4 ou 5 mois. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Aïda N., 32, is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank KIR-DIOM for two years and has received 4 loans which she managed well and reimbursed. With her loan she wants to fatten cattle. She buys cows, rids them of parasites with veterinary products, fattens them, and resells them after 4 or 5 months. Her goal is to help support her family and be able to put aside more in savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Alex Nyongesa

texts.en:
Alex Nyongesa M. is a poultry farmer. He lives in Lwanyange, Busia district. he is 45years old, married and blessed with 6 children. Fredrick believes poultry farming business is the new big business venture in Western Kenya, besides the cereals and sugarcane businesses.
He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 improve his poultry structure thus create room for more chicks.

loans.use: improve poultry structure

loans.name: Danilo's Group

texts.en:
Danilo G. is from the village of Maligaya in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Danilo is the leader of a 9-member group loan sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Danilo is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a general store where he sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Danilo is just starting this business.

In 2009, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Danilo's second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine T. is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years. Like many of her neighbors, she raises animals (cattle, sheep and pigs) which she sells at the grand market in the nearby town of Bambey. This loan will allow her to buy more cattle and sheep to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle and sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Faatoaga

texts.en:
Faatoaga  M. is 48 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, raising pigs for sale.  Faatoaga  has 5 years of experience in this business.  Faatoaga  needs a loan of WST $1250 to build shelter for the borrower's livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from her business  to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faatoaga  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faatoaga 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faatoaga  M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to build shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Despite being poor, Melecia D. is very happy with her life because she has two loving children (aged 9 and 12), and a very supportive husband. Before she became a member of ASHI in 2009, she devoted her time to taking care of her children and attending to the needs of her family. She would make sure that, when her husband came home from working in the rice field all day, a meal was prepared that they would share on their small table. However, there would be times when she had nothing to prepare because her husband, being the sole provider and a hired farm laborer, had a small and sporadic income. Melecia aspired to have her own business and to play an economically productive role as well as raising children. 

In 2009, with the support of her husband, she joined ASHI and requested a loan. She started a hog fattening and a rice retail business. With her business she was able to augment her husband’s income and their lives have now improved a bit. Melecia is now requesting a much larger loan to really grow her business and profits. She wishes to raise more hogs and to sell large volumes of rice from their house. Someday she hopes to have enough business capital to build a store, separate from their house, where she can sell grocery items and rice to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for fattening and increase the volume of rice she sells in her store.

loans.name: Julia Dina

texts.es: Julia es de 30 años de edad, soltera, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como enfermera en un hospital de la localidad, en sus ratos libre se dedica a vender  ropa por catálogos, en la cual tiene aproximadamente 10 años de realizarlo, solicita su quinto crédito  para incrementar su capital de trabajo, los anteriores créditos los pago bien.
texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old, and works as a nurse at a local hospital. During her free time, Julia sells clothing from a catalogue which she's been doing for the past 10 years. This is her 5th loan, which she will use to increase her inventory. She has paid off her previous loans without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reginaldo Fernando

texts.pt:
Reginaldo Fernando M. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 43 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 25, 18, 14 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe do antigo sistema e não continuou devido a guerra de ocupação colonial. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu tio e irmão que vivem com ele. 
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatório, veio sozinho e mais tarde troche a família para residirem juntos em Boane. É serralheiro de profissão ha mais de 23 anos, tem 3 empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu trabalho e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma tia que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar ferro para o fabrico de grades e portas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock e responder a demanda da sua clientela. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar sua serralharia e fazer crescer ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Reginaldo Fernando M. was born in the Massinga district in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 25, 18, 14 and 11 years old. All of them are in school. Reginaldo only studied through the 4th level under the old system of education. He didn't continue with his studies due to the war of colonial occupation. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of an uncle and a brother who live with him. Reginaldo left Inhambane for Maputo in order to comply with the obligatory military service. He first arrived alone and then brought his family so that they could live together in Boane. He has worked as a blacksmith for more than 23 years and has 3 employees who help him in his work. He has a monthly income of around 12,000.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account each month. He has never taken out a loan with another bank, and found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through an aunt who also works with the institution. This is his 1st loan, for the amount of 13,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy iron for making grates and doors, in order to increase his stock and respond to his customers' demand. Reginaldo promises to repay this loan as agreed, in order to be eligible for other loans in the future. He plans to ask for future loans to expand his shop and make his business grow even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron for making grates and doors.

loans.name: Safari Group

texts.en:
Meet J. K. and the Safari Group.  J. is 48 years old, married and has four daughters.  J. has run a charcoal business for two years.  

Charcoal is important in Tanzania, because it is used for cooking in almost every home and restaurant.  J. leaves Dar Es Salaam to travel to the countryside, where he spends 5-6 days making charcoal from trees that he harvests.  He returns to the city with his product and sells it to wholesale and retail buyers.  

J. paid back his previous two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, and will use this loan to expand his business.  He wants to hire more laborers to help him produce the charcoal, which will allow him to organize up to 15 sacks per trip.  He currently yields around ten sacks.  This should increase his profit, which is currently 320,000 Tsh (around $228) per month.  The extra profit will help J. support his children, and he hopes to reinvest and continue growing his business.

J. is the president of the Safari Group.  The name means "Journey" in Kiswahili.  The group's members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

In the photo, J. is seated in the front row.

loans.use: Producing and selling more charcoal.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo H. vazquez, tiene  39 años, es casado y tiene dos hijas, su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica,  y el trabaja en un centro comercial, no ganan mucho pero quieren poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, por eso solicitan este préstamo por que requieren comprar el material para colocar vitropiso en el interior de su casa, ya que solo cuentan con piso de cemento.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo H. Vazquez is 39 years old, married, and has two daughters. His wife works as a domestic employee and he works in a commercial center. They do not earn much but they want to start improving their house little by little. For this purpose they are requesting a loan because they need to buy the materials to put down tile in the interior of the house, since now they have just cement floors.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of floor tiles

loans.name: Juubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  JUUBO est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de NDOFFENE 1, il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes mariées et mère d’au moins de 5 enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et se sont solidairement organisées de puis plus de 03 ans. Elles ont comme principales l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine, la transformation et vente d’huile d’arachide et de céréales locales. La position géographique du village est profitable aux membres du groupe et aux femmes  du village en général, car beaucoup de marchés hebdomadaires sont polarisés par ledit village. Alors, en moyenne, 04 jours sur 07 les femmes sillonnent ces marchés pour mener des activités commerciales. Ce prêt qui leur est octroyé leur permettra d’acheter des bœufs et de petits ruminants pour l’embouche et des arachides et des céréales locales pour le petit commerce.
Siga S., pour des raisons de décès d’un proche est absente lors de la prise de photo et n’y figure pas

Fatou Elhadj D. debout à droite au second rang de la photo est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Elle mène des activités diverses, comme la vente d’huile d’arachide, de céréales locales et elle fait aussi de l’embouche ovine. Son nouveau prêt lui servira essentiellement à acheter des moutons qu’elle va engraisser et revendre  au bout de 5 mois. Quant au petit commerce elle va le mener avec les revenus qu’elle a pu réaliser à partir des ses activités antérieures. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de ses enfants surtout en ce qui concerne leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The Juubo Group is one of the community support groups of Ndoffene 1 Banc Villageois. It is made up of eight women, all of whom are married and have at least five children. They have an average age of 50 and have been working together for over three years. Their main activities are raising cattle and/or sheep, processing and selling peanut oil and local grain. The location of the village is advantageous to the group members and village women in general because many weekly markets are held nearby. So, on average, the women travel to the markets to sell their goods four days out of seven. This loan that they have been granted will allow them to buy steers and small ruminant animals to rear, as well as peanuts and local grain for their small-scale business. Due to the death of a family member, Siga S. was not present when the photo was taken, so she is not in it. Fatou Elhadj D., standing on the right in the second row, is 48 years old and she has seven children. She conducts various business activities, such as selling peanut oil and local grain, as well as raising sheep. This new loan will basically allow her to buy some sheep that she will fatten up and sell after five months. As for the small-scale business, she will run it on the income she has made from her previous business activities. Her aim is to play a part in taking care of her children's needs, especially their schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen the finances of this community support group

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover personal household expenses

loans.name: Ceralyn

texts.en:
Ceralyn D. is from the village of Bularan, Miputak. She is 26 years old. Ceralyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ceralyn owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Ceralyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ceralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ceralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Ceralyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ceralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Akber's Group

texts.en:
Akber lives in a small city called Borewala which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She has been living in this city with her family for over 20 years. She is 41 years old, a housewife and makes artificial flowers in her spare time to facilitate her husband financially. Her husband is involved in the spice selling business. He sells spices and also provides the services of blending spices for his customers by using a blender machine. Most of his customers come to him for blending their spices. He has been doing this work for over fifteen years.

Now his eldest son has also started this same business to help his family financially. He left his education after10th grade and started this business because his family needed his financial support. Akber’s youngest son is in sixth grade. She wants him to complete his education and become a doctor.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her eldest son. With the loan amount he will buy a blender machine and spices of different kinds and improve his business. Akber is in her 2nd loan cycle and has proved to be a very responsible loan user with Asasah. She has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase spices & blender machine

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: felicitas tiene 70 alños, ella vive en casa con sus dos hijos los cuales son mayores ella trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de especerias el que le permite tener sus ingresos para el sustento de su casa, Felicitas sueña con implementar su negocio y tener mas puestos de venta, para poder tener mayores ingresos, se le propone el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 70 years old and lives at home with her two adult sons. She has a small business selling assorted wares that allows her to have income to support her household. She dreams with stocking her business with more items and having additional sales stands so that income can be higher. The loan is proposed to her because her personal references and ability to pay are good.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. sells cassava, plantain and bananas at Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy assorted fruits to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profit in her business.

Abena has been through senior high school. She is divorced and lives with her child. She is responsible for feeding, educating and clothing her child.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Omar Adolfo

texts.es:
El cliente Omar Adolfo L. V.. Vive en el municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león del centro de salud 1/2c al sur, Es Casado tiene 3 hijos a su cargo  trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como administrador tiene 9 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación en malas condiciones el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de sementó y Ladrillos para la mejora de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Omar lives in the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, in the León region of Nicaragua. He is married and has 3 children. He works in the town hall of Santa Rosa Del Peñón as an administrator. He has worked there for 9 years. 
Omar’s home is in poor condition and he wants to make improvements. His loan will be used to buy cement and bricks. This will enable him to improve his home and his family’s well-being.

loans.use: Purchase cement and bricks for home improvements

loans.name: María Imelda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora María tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, el menor que es soltero vive con ella. Su marido es profesor en un colegio artesanal.

Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de pollos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 16h00  en su local en el mercado de Montecristi. Compra los pollos en pie a comerciantes que le llevan hasta su local, luego los pela y los vende por libras, tiene este negocio ya por 5 años y dice que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más pollos y una  báscula para pesar los pollos  ya que la que tiene esta deteriorada y le ha causado molestias. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le ha gustado porque se han mantenido desde el principio con los mismos principios que son los de ayudarlas a salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank Aníbal San Andrés meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized nationally and internationally.  It is a place famous for its toquilla straw hats (Panama hats).

Mrs. María is 54, is in a communal marriage and has three children, two who are now adults.  The youngest is single and lives with her.  Her husband is a teacher in a handicrafts school.

Maria’s business is buying and selling chickens.  She works daily from 6 am until 4 pm in her stand in the Montecristi Market.  She purchases the chickens from the merchants who bring them to her stand, then she cleans the chickens and sells them by the pound.  She has had the stand for 5 years and says that it is going well.

The loan will be used to buy more chickens and a scale to weigh them, since the scale that she has is in poor condition and has caused problems.  She has been in the communal bank since she started and she likes it because it has continued with the same principles to help the members get ahead.

Her dream is to have a bigger stand.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a scale

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 66 years old and married. She has a sari-sari (retail) store that she manages with her husband. They both work hard to improve their business. Aurea sells coconut wine and bananas and she is planning to also sell rice. 

Aurea joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Aurea is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase sacks of rice and other products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and other products to sell

loans.name: Ertrudes

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ertrudes.  Ella tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta linda relación que la ha cuidado por tantos años tiene un hijo de 17 años, el cual estudia en el último año del colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas tales como: gaseosas, aguas, bebidas energizantes, cervezas, bocadillos, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, los productos que son de fabrica los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes , aguas cervezas y otros productos. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace ya varios años y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe. Sus sueños son tener un bar completo y más grande.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo canton is in the Manabí province.  It is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, a variety of fauna, and its hard-working people who devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  This is where the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For a Better Future) meets every two weeks.

This is where we find 54 year old Ertrudes.  She has taken great care of her long time, beautiful marriage, and she and her husband have a 17 year old child.  He is in his last year of school.  Her husband is a merchant.

In addition to being a very good housewife, she is also a merchant.  She has a small bar where she sells drinks like soft drinks, water, energizing drinks, beer, and snacks, etc.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She gets the factory products for her place.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, energizing drinks, water, beer, and other products.  She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning several years ago.  She likes the benefits that she receives.  Her dream is to have a replete and larger bar.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, energizing drinks, water, and beer, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).   

Margaret has a business selling mattresses and cushions.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products in a retail shop.  Margaret has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mattresses and cushions. 

The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land for her business premise.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business premise, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses and cushions for resale

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Mabini in the municipality of Baliangao, a part of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Elvie makes and sells food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, to the local community. She has been in business for over twelve years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC that was used for personal purposes. Elvie is requesting a new loan, her 22nd from PMPC, of 9,000 PHP that will be used as additional capital for the business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Oem P. is a modest villager living in the province of Siem Reap. She owns farmland in the village where she plants rice and vegetable crops to make an income. Oem P. is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children who are still single. Two of her children help her with the family's daily expenses by working as a fisherman and a porter in and around Tunle Sap River.

Presently, it is a good time for doing a dry-season rice-field, but Oem P. has still not planted her crops yet. Therefore, Oem P. hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and also to assist her son by buying fishing implements to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to buy fishing implements.

loans.name: Tabitha  Wanja

texts.en:
Tabitha Wanja M. is a 48-year-old lady, married to Philip, and they have one child. Tabitha has owned a catering business  for the last ten years. 

This is her second loan from KADET, and she plans to use it to purchase an electric generator which is essential for the business.

She will spend the anticipated profits on her child’s education. Her dream for the future is to open a hotel.

loans.use: purchase an electric generator

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and rent bills. 

She has operated a vegetable-stall business for the past two years, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. Julia faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable-stall operators. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, vegetables, and building materials to expand her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, vegetables, and building materials to expand her stall.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma G. is from the village of Nagassican, Santiago City. She is 55 years old. Erma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erma is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Erma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw material to produce gara (dyed fabric) clothing

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua Y. sells fish in Abrafo, at a village near Abura. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children. Her income from selling fish helps pay for the family’s utility bills and the children’s school fees. She has been selling fish for five years. 

As shown in the photo, Ekua sells her fish by carrying it around the village and the market. She wants to grow her business. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell to increase her income. Additional profits will be plowed back into her business for further expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to increase her income

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Q. Trương Thị (20203050021) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Q. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 1 nhóm 04  (Nhóm 04).


Q. is married and has two school-aged children. Q. owns & operates a business venture manufacturing furniture. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Q. has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.


In 2009, Q. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Q. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND, which will be used to purchase wood as material to expand her production scale.  This will be Q.'s third loan from SEDA. Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her furniture manufacturing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Q. Trương Thị (20203050021) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Q. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 1 nhóm 04  (Nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Q. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Q. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Q. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Q. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase  wood as material

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Rumichaca,  provincia D. Urubamba y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; es  casada, la socia tiene 8 hijos todos sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, cada uno tiene sus hijos y viven aparte, la socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chicha D. jora, la socia hace la mejor chicha del pueblo ella toma los mejores granos y los macera para elaborar sus chicha. La socia en sus casa a ampliado hace ya algunos años atrás un espacio para poder recibir a sus clientes y ofrecerles la chicha D. jora acompañando con un aperitivo llamado zarza esta comprenD. unos trozos D. carne cocida con cebollines y hierbas aromáticas en sal y limón, con trozos D. rocoto para darle el sabor final. La socia es una mujer muy optimista y llena D. vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. maíz para elaborar su chicha.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Emiliana belongs to the Manos Juntas Rumichaca – Alta Communal Bank.  It is located in the town of Rumichaca, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Emiliana is married and has eight children.  All of them are adults and independent.  Each one of them has children and lives separately.  

Emiliana makes and sells “chicha D. jora” (a drink maD. from fermented corn).  She sells this with an appetizer called “zarza”.  This is maD. with pieces of cooked meat, chives, and aromatic herbs in salt and lemon.  Pieces of peppers are added to give it the final flavor.

She is a very optimistic woman who is full of life.  She is requesting the loan to be able to buy corn to make her chicha.

She is very grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy corn to make her chicha.
